headline: "Don't Get The Secret Of Kiren Rijiju's Youth": Chief Justice Joshes Law Minister
description: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana thanked Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju and the government today for creation of legal infrastructure and the appointment of judges.  His praise also came with some open pleasantry.

headline: Maharashtra Minister's Reply To Defamation Case By Sameer Wankhede Father
description: Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik today told the Bombay High Court that the defamation suit filed against him by Dhyandev Wankhede, father of NCB zonal director Sameer Wankhede, was only an attempt to cover-up the "illegalities"

headline: Fourth Scorpene Submarine 'Vela' Delivered To Navy
description: The fourth Scorpene submarine of Project - 75, Yard 11878 was delivered to the Navy on Tuesday.

headline: Amit Mitra To Be Appointed As Principal Chief Adviser To Mamata Banerjee
description: Amit Mitra, who has held finance portfolio in West Bengal over past one decade, is set to get appointed as principal chief adviser to chief minister and finance department, with his tenure as state minister having ended on November 5.

headline: Eye On Rural Polls, BJP To Organise Four-Day Yatra In Karnataka Next Week
description: The BJP will launch a four-day ''Jan Swaraj Yatra'' across Karnataka from November 18 with an eye on winning the coming taluk panchayat and district panchayat elections, the party's state spokesperson Ganesh Karnik said here today.

headline: Anti-Drugs Agency Officer's Wife, Father Meet Maharashtra Governor Over Minister's Allegations
description: NCB zonal director Sameer Wankhede's wife Kranti Redkar and father Dnyandev Wankhede on Tuesday met Maharashtra governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari and submitted a complaint against state minister Nawab Malik.

headline: Amid Violence Allegations, BJP Wins 34% Seats Unopposed In Tripura Civic Bodies
description: Amid allegations of pre-poll violence and intimidation by opposition parties in Tripura, the ruling BJP won 112 of the 334 seats uncontested in the Agartala Municipal Corporation or AMC and 19 urban local bodies ahead of the November 25 elections.

headline: Mallikarjun Kharge Slams Centre Over Malnourishment Data
description: Senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said the children of the country are paying the price for the Narendra Modi dispensation's "incompetence" after government data showed that 33 lakh children in India are still malnourished.

headline: Watch: Transgender Folk Dancer Receives Padma Shri, With A Unique Gesture
description: Transgender folk dancer Manjamma Jogati received a Padma Shri honour for her contribution to arts today.

headline: Drugs Worth Rs 1 Crore Seized In Odisha, Two Arrested: Police
description: The Odisha Police has busted an interstate drug racket and arrested two persons in Balasore district after brown sugar worth around Rs 1 crore was seized from their possession, an officer said today.

headline: "Unfair" To Create Rift Between Bengal Speaker And His Deputy: Mamata Banerjee
description: Targeting West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar without naming him, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said nobody should try to create a rift between the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker, calling such an attempt "unacceptable and unfair".

headline: Supreme Court To Hear Ex Fortis Healthcare Promoter's Bail Plea On Nov 11
description: The Supreme Court Tuesday said it would hear on November 11 the bail plea of former Fortis Healthcare promoter Shivinder Mohan Singh who is accused of misappropriating Rs 2,397 crore of Religare Finvest Ltd funds.

headline: Farmer Unions Announce Tractor March To Parliament Every Day From November 29
description: Farmer unions protesting against the Centre's new farm laws have decided to take out peaceful tractor marches to Parliament, every day during the Winter Session from November 29, shortly after their protest at the Delhi border completes one year.

headline: CBI Seeks Centre Nod To Invoke Official Secrets Act Over Submarine Leaks
description: The CBI has asked the government for permission to invoke the Official Secrets Act against arrested Navy officers accused of passing on confidential information about India's submarines to "unauthorised persons", sources told NDTV on Tuesday.

headline: Reopen Kartarpur Corridor Before Gurpurab: Punjab Chief Minister Urges PM
description: Punjab Chief Minister Charanjit Singh Channi appealed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi to reopen the Kartarpur Corridor, ahead of the Prakash Purab (birth anniversary) of Sikh Guru Nanak Dev this month.

headline: Signing Of New Pact On Naga Issue To Bring New Developments: Nagaland Chief Minister
description: Nagaland Chief Minister Neiphiu Rio on Tuesday said the signing of a new agreement between the Centre and any of the negotiating groups to find a solution to the vexed Naga issue would bring new developments and make the state "very very special".

headline: "Devastating Consequences": Centre On Unregulated Foreign Funds For NGOs
description: The centre has defended its move to amend a law on foreign funding for non-profits over concerns that most of the money comes for development work is often diverted to train Maoists.

headline: Targeted Civilian Killings Pak Conspiracy To Disturb Peace: J&K BJP Chief
description: Jammu and Kashmir BJP president Ravinder Raina on Tuesday said the targeted killing of innocent civilians by terrorists in the valley is a conspiracy of Pakistan to disturb peace in the Union Territory.

headline: Samajwadi Party's Agenda "Confined To Them, Their Families": Yogi Adityanath
description: UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath asked people to remember that freeing terrorists involved in attacking Sri Ram Janmabhoomi in Ayodhya were among the first acts of the Samajwadi Party government in 2012.

headline: 96 Nations Agree To Mutually Accept Vaccine Certificates With India: Minister
description: Ninety-six countries have agreed to mutual recognition of COVID-19 vaccination certificates with India, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said today.

headline: "Public Won't Forget Easily": Mayawati On Hike In Fuel Prices
description: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati today slammed the Bharatiya Janata Party government over the increase in fuel prices and said that the public will not forget this easily.

headline: In Punjab Chief Minister's Truce With Navjot Sidhu, Top Lawyer Is Out
description: Chief Minister Charanjit Channi said he had accepted APS Deol's resignation as the Punjab's Advocate-General, in a move that meets sulking Congress leader Navjot Sidhu's demand and signals a truce between the party's top two leaders in the state.

headline: Bahujan Samaj Party Won't Enter Alliance With Any Party: Mayawati
description: Ahead of the 2022 Uttar Pradesh polls, Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) chief Mayawati today said that the BSP will not enter into an alliance with any political party and will get an absolute majority just like they did in the 2007 assembly elections.

headline: Follow Process In Disciplinary Cases Against Staff, Centre Tells Departments
description: The centre has asked all its departments to follow vital procedures while processing disciplinary cases against employees, failure of which has led to intervention by courts, according to a Personnel Ministry order.

headline: "China Building Helipads...": Centre To Supreme Court On "Char Dham" Roads
description: The needs of defence and environment have to be balanced and a "nuanced" approach is required, the Supreme Court said today while hearing an appeal against the widening of roads in Uttarakhand hills for the "Char Dham project".

headline: Aryan Khan Case Witness Sent To Judicial Custody In Cheating Case
description: Narcotics Control Bureau's (NCB) independent witness in the Mumbai cruise raid case Kiran Gosavi has been sent to Judicial custody by a Pune court on Tuesday in a cheating case registered against him at Faraskhana police station.

headline: Court To Hear Plea Against Bar On Married People Joining Army's Legal Wing
description: The Delhi High Court today said it will hear on January 11 a plea challenging the restriction on married individuals being considered for the Judge Advocate General (JAG) department, the legal arm of the army.

headline: Maharashtra Minister Demands Probe Into New Rafale Report
description: Maharashtra Cabinet Minister Nawab Malik demanded that the centre should investigate claims made by a French portal that Rafale makers paid 7.5 million Euros to middlemen between 2007 and 2012.

headline: Once Budaun Was Known As Vedamau, Centre Of Vedas Studies: Yogi Adityanath
description: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said Budaun was in ancient times known as Vedamau and it was a centre of studies of the Vedas.

headline: New Rafale Twist: Papers Show Agencies Didn't Act On Alleged Kickbacks
description: NDTV has found more evidence that Indian agencies ignored allegations that French company Dassault may have paid crores of rupees to middlemen spanning both the BJP-led NDA 1.0 government and the Congress-led UPA.

headline: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Visits Chennai Amid Floods, Distributes Food
description: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin today visited rain-affected and water-logged areas in Chennai and distributed food to needy people in various parts of the city.

headline: Centre Should Distribute Money Raised From Oil Prices: Mamata Banerjee
description:
Claiming that the Centre has raised Rs 4 lakh crore in the recent times from increased fuel prices, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday demanded that the money be equally distributed among states.

Oil Prices

headline: 2 Maharashtra Cops Sent To CID Custody For 7 Days In Extortion Case
description: A Mumbai court today remanded two police officers in the custody of the Maharashtra CID custody for 7 days in connection with an extortion case registered against them and former city police commissioner Param Bir Singh.

headline: Two Dead In Suspected Case Of Spurious Liquor In Bihar's Muzaffarpur
description: Two persons have died in yet another suspected hooch tragedy in Bihar, a dry state where consumption of spurious liquor has claimed more than 40 lives in less than a fortnight.

headline: US Special Envoy For Afghanistan To Visit India, Pakistan
description: US special envoy for Afghanistan, Thomas West, said he plans to visit India and Pakistan as part of his upcoming trip to Europe and Asia

headline: Biennial Polls To Legislative Councils In 4 States On December 10: Election Commission
description: Biennial elections to the legislative councils in Maharashtra, Telangana, Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh from 42 local authorities' constituencies will be held on December 10, the Election Commission announced on Tuesday.

headline: "Scheduling Reasons": China On Not Attending Delhi Security Dialogue
description: China said on Tuesday that it is not attending the security dialogue on Afghanistan convened by India due to "scheduling reasons".

headline: Lucknow Farmers' Meet Will Be "Last Nail In Coffin": Farmer Leader Rakesh Tikait
description: Bharatiya Kisan Union (BKU) leader Rakesh Tikait today warned the centre of intensifying the farmers' agitation in the Purvanchal region in poll-bound Uttar Pradesh.

headline: Tiger Spotted In Jharkhand Tiger Reserve After Stretch Of No Sightings
description: A tiger was spotted in Jharkhand's Palamau Tiger Reserve (PTR), a top forest official said on Tuesday. The sighting of the tiger on Monday evening resulted in a wave of happiness among officials and employees of the Palamau Tiger Reserve.

headline: Yamuna's Toxic Foam "Gift" To Delhi From UP, Haryana: AAP Leader
description: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA and Delhi Jal Board Vice Chairman Raghav Chadha today said that the toxic foam found floating on the Yamuna river was a "gift" to Delhi from the governments in Uttar Pradesh and Haryana.

headline: Defence Capability Building Vital Given Disputed Borders, Says Army Chief
description: Chief of the Army Staff (COAS) General MM Naravane on Tuesday said capability development of the armed forces remains a national imperative given the country's active and disputed borders with two neighbours

headline: PM Modi Greets People Of Uttarakhand On State's Formation Day
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday greeted people of Uttarakhand on the state's formation day, and said its progress in the last five years has given him confidence that this decade will belong to it.

headline: Nepal Army Chief On 4-Day India Visit To Bolster Defence Ties
description: Nepal Army chief GenPrabhu Ram Sharma on Tuesday embarked on a four-day visit to India to step up defence ties between the two neighbouring nations.

headline: Madhya Pradesh Orders Safety Audit Of All Hospitals After Bhopal Fire Kills 4
description: A day after the death of four newborns in a fire at a hospital in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan today ordered fire safety audit of all government and private hospitals in the state.

headline: Mizoram Chief Minister Gets Clean Chit In Abuse Of Power, Corruption Case
description: A special court, under the Prevention of Corruption Act, has acquitted Mizoram Chief Minister Zoramthanga in two cases -- one related to misuse of power and the other to possession of disproportionate assets.

headline: Keep Fighting "Corrupt" BJP Government: Rahul Gandhi On Rafale Deal
description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi today asked his party colleagues to not stop or be afraid of fighting against the "corrupt" central government as truth was with them in every step.

headline: 5 Dead, 538 Huts Damaged In Tamil Nadu Amid Extremely Heavy Rains
description: At least five persons died and as many as 538 huts and four houses have been completely damaged in Tamil Nadu due to incessant rains.

headline: Witness Appears For Questioning In Aryan Khan Case For 2nd Day
description: Prabhakar Sail, an independent witness, appeared before the NCB in Mumbai for the second day on Tuesday in connection with its probe into the pay-off allegations in the cruise drugs case in which Aryan Khan is an accused, an NCB official said.

headline: "What Have You Been Doing Since 2015?" Court Rebuke On Chennai Flooding
description: The Chennai civic body was pulled up today by the Madras High Court, for the huge flooding the city has been struggling with for the last four days. The court warned that it would take up the matter on its own if the situation does not improve by Sat

headline: "Hydrogen Bomb Tomorrow," Maharashtra Minister Warns Devendra Fadnavis
description: Former Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, who had teased a post-Diwali "expose" on state Minister Nawab Malik, delivered on his promise today.

headline: Manipur Congress Leaders Meet Sonia Gandhi Ahead Of State Polls Next Year
description: Ahead of the 2022 assembly elections, a meeting of Manipur Congress leaders with party interim president Sonia Gandhi is underway at her residence in the national capital on Tuesday, informed sources.

headline: Dengue Cases Piling Up, Outbreak Worst In Several Years: Delhi Hospital
description: The dengue outbreak in Delhi is "far more as compared to the last two-three years", a senior doctor at the city's Ganga Ram Hospital told NDTV today, as she warned people against not following basic sanitary practices after the monsoon season.

headline: Magsaysay Awardee Sanjeev Chaturvedi Quits Corbett Park Corruption Probe
description: Ramon Magsaysay award recipient IFS officer Sanjeev Chaturvedi has withdrawn himself from probing the role of officials in illegal constructions in Uttarakhand's Corbett Tiger Reserve.

headline: "Farmers Not At Fault": Delhi Environment Minister On Crop Burning In Punjab
description: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader and Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai today said free spraying of bio-decomposer will be ensured in Punjab to curb crop residue burning if his party forms government in the state.

headline: Actor Poonam Pandey's Husband Arrested For Allegedly Assaulting Her: Cops
description: Actor Poonam Pandey's husband Sam Bombay has been arrested by the Mumbai police for allegedly assaulting his wife.

headline: "Rahul Gandhi Must Answer": BJP Attacks Congress Over New Rafale Report
description: A massive political fight has been reignited by a new report on alleged kickbacks paid between 2007 and 2012 to a middleman involved in the Rafale deal, and on the CBI allegedly failing to investigate these allegations despite receiving documents.

headline: Supreme Court To Consider Hearing Plea On Bengaluru Civic Body Polls
description: The Supreme Court today agreed to consider listing a plea of the Karnataka government against the high court verdict asking the State Election Commission (SEC) to hold elections to 198 wards of the 'Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike' (BBMP).

headline: Reduce Excise Duty On Fuel: Rajasthan Chief Minister Writes To PM Modi
description: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to further reduce excise duty on fuel to provide relief to the people.

headline: BJP Leader Says "
description: BJP leader P Muralidhar Rao's comment about

headline: Wanted Criminal, Aide Killed By Villagers In Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior
description: A criminal with a reward of Rs 10,000, and another man accompanying him, was killed with an axe at Dharmpura village in Gijorra, Gwalior following a dispute with villagers on Monday.

headline: Indore Engineer Caught Taking Rs 50,000 Cash, Rs 11.5 Lakh Cheque Bribe
description: The Lokayukta police caught an executive engineer of the National Health Mission (NHM) while he was allegedly taking a bribe of Rs 50,000 in cash and a cheque of Rs 11.5 lakh from a contractor in Madhya Pradesh, an official said.

headline: Viral Pic: Padma Shri Winner and Karnataka Environmentalist Greets PM
description: Tulsi Gowda, an environmentalist, was among the 119 Padma award recipients for the year 2020. A photo of the Karnataka tribal greeting Prime Minister Narendra Modi, top ministers and dignitaries at the function was widely shared on social media.

headline: "My Ministers Don't Know Hindi": Mizoram Chief Minister To Amit Shah
description: The state ministers don't understand Hindi and some of them don't even know English, Mizoram Chief Minister Pu Zoramthanga said in his letter to Home Minister Amit Shah urging him to modify the centre's order and replace the state chief secretary.

headline: For LK Advani's Birthday, Sushma Swaraj's Daughter Continues A Tradition
description: Former External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj's daughter Bansuri Swaraj on Monday visited LK Advani to greet him on his birthday.

headline: Mukesh Ambani's Address Sought By Tourist, He Is Detained
description: A 40-year-old man - Suresh Visanji Patel - has been taken into custody by Mumbai Police after a security red-flag around industrialist Mukesh Ambani's city residence - Antilia - on Monday night.

headline: 10,126 Fresh Covid Cases In India, Lowest Daily Rise Since Early February: 10 Points
description: India saw the lowest daily rise in coronavirus cases since early February with 10,126 fresh infections in a sign of relief as the country looks forward to an increase in the vaccination pace amid the fight against COVID-19.

headline: Navjot Sidhu To Visit Dera Baba Nanak Today For Kartarpur Corridor Reopening
description: Congress Punjab President Navjot Singh Sidhu today will visit the Dera Baba Nanak shrine in Gurdaspur and offer prayers for the reopening of the Kartarpur Corridor so that devotees could visit the shrine dedicated to Sikh Guru Nanak Dev in Pakistan.

headline: Anti-Drugs Agency Officer's Father Files Police Complaint Against Maharashtra Minister Nawab Malik
description: NCB officer Sameer Wankhede's father alleged that Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik made false accusations regarding his family's caste.

headline: UP At Top Position In India For COVID-19 Testing, Vaccination: Yogi Adityanath
description: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Monday appreciated the collective efforts of the state government of COVID-19 management and said that the state is at the top position in the country, in terms of COVID-19 vaccination and testing.

headline: Coronavirus Highlights: India Reports 10,126 New Cases, 332 Deaths In Last 24 Hours
description: India reported 10,126 new coronavirus cases on Monday, the lowest in 266 days, besides 332 more virus-related deaths. Meanwhile, the recovery count increased to 3,37,75,086 with 11,982 recoveries being reported in the last 24 hours.

headline: Srinagar On UNESCO Creative Cities List, PM Modi Congratulates People Of J&K
description: Srinagar has made it to the prestigious list of the UNESCO creative cities network for craft and folk art, a huge recognition for the centuries old craft and heritage of Kashmir.

headline: Independent Witness In Drugs-On-Cruise Case Questioned For Over 10 Hours
description: Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) vigilance team, led by NCB Deputy Director General Gyaneshwar Singh has questioned Prabhakar Sail, a witness in the drugs-on-cruise case, to record his statement in the alleged payoff in the case.

headline: Aryan Khan Case Witness Kiran Gosavi's Police Custody Extended By One Day
description: A Pune court on Monday extended by one day the police custody of Kiran Gosavi, an NCB witness arrested in a cheating case registered against him in the city.
BJP leader P Muralidhar Rao on Monday triggered a huge row with his statement that people belonging to Brahmin and Baniya communities are in his "pockets".

headline: India Will Continue To Oppose Aggression Attempts On Land, Sea: Defence Secretary
description: Defence Secretary Ajay Kumar on Monday said India will work with all willing nations for peace in the region, push for a rules-bound world and continue to oppose attempts of aggression on land and the sea.

headline: Men Shouldn't Interfere In Work Of Women
description: Maharashtra Industries Minister Subhash Desai on Monday said men should not interfere in the work of women sarpanches and let them learn through experience.

headline: 'Was Invited To Same Cruise As Aryan Khan But...': Maharashtra Minister
description: Maharashtra minister and Congress leader Aslam Shaikh today said he was invited by one Kashif Khan to the cruise party on October 2, which was busted by the Narcotics Control Bureau, leading to the arrest of Aryan Khan, son of actor Shah Rukh Khan.

headline: Bhopal Hospital Where 4 Newborns Died Never Applied For Fire Clearance
description: At least four children admitted in the government-run Kamala Nehru Children's Hospital in Bhopal died in a fire that broke out on Monday night, Medical Education Minister Vishwas Sarang said.

headline: In Kashmir, Scores Of PM CARES Ventilators Fail Trial Run
description: Most ventilators supplied under PM CARES fund in Kashmir have been found defective and "unfit for critical care" on trial runs.

headline: UK To Recognise Covaxin, No Quarantine For Fully Vaccinated Travellers
description: Britain said it would recognise COVID-19 vaccines on the World Health Organization's Emergency Use Listing later this month, adding China's Sinovac, Sinopharm and India's Covaxin to the country's approved list of vaccines for inbound travellers.

headline: J&K Extra Troops Leave Public Buildings Amid Outcry, Political Row
description: After a row over use of marriage halls and community centres as security barracks in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar, the paramilitary Central Reserve Police Force or CRPF has started vacating them and shifting its personnel to other accommodation.

headline: "Cooked-Up Witness" In Delhi Riots Case, Says Accused Umar Khalid
description: Former JNU student leader Umar Khalid told a court statements of the witnesses in Delhi riots conspiracy case were written by someone else and given to them as police did not have any evidence, and a case can't be made against him on half-truths.

headline: UK's Boris Johnson Urges "Determined Push" For Climate Change Deal
description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Wednesday said a UN climate change summit had made progress towards halting runaway climate change but more was needed to seal a deal.

headline: Meghan Markle Knew Letter To Father Could Be Leaked, Claims Ex-Aide
description: The Duchess of Sussex understood that a letter at the centre of a privacy breach row with a British newspaper could be leaked by her father, a court was told Wednesday.

headline: Joe Biden Says Inflation "Top Priority" As US Prices Hit 30-Year High
description: President Joe Biden has made fighting US inflation his "top priority" after government data showed it reached a 30-year high last month, underscoring the continued threat to his presidency and the economic recovery.

headline: China's Xi Jinping Calls For US Cooperation Ahead Of Joe Biden Talks
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping called for cooperation with the United States ahead of long-awaited talks with Joe Biden that comes amid a slew of disputes between the two powers.

headline: Sweden May Have Its First Woman Prime Minister As Stefan Lofven Resigns
description: Swedish Prime Minister Stefan Lofven resigned Wednesday, paving the way for the country, a gender-equality champion, to finally have a woman prime minister.

headline: Producers Target 2040 End Date For Polluting Vehicles But Not All Agree
description: Countries and manufacturers Wednesday agreed to phase out sales of internal combustion engine vehicles by 2040 in a pledge at COP26 that the world's top four producers did not sign.

headline: ISIS In Afghanistan "Under Control": Taliban
description: Afghanistan's Taliban rulers said Wednesday that the threat posed by the ISIS group in the country was "more or less under control" despite recent bloody attacks that have killed dozens.

headline: Asia's Most Expensive Apartment Sold For $82 Million
description: A Hong Kong apartment sold for HK$640 million ($82.2 million), making it Asia's most expensive per square foot in a further sign of buoyancy in the city's upscale housing market.

headline: Booster Shot Demand Surges As France Makes It Mandatory For Vaccine Pass
description: Demand for Covid booster jabs jumped in France after President Emmanuel Macron said a top-up dose would be necessary for people to retain their vaccine passes, the country's main appointment booking site said Wednesday.

headline: Sputnik V Maker Calls For Mandatory Vaccination In Russia As Deaths Surge
description: The developer of Russia's coronavirus vaccine Sputnik V has said Moscow should make jabs mandatory as inoculation rates remain low despite record deaths and campaigning by authorities.

headline: Myanmar Junta Charges US Journalist With Terrorism, Sedition
description: Myanmar's junta has charged a US journalist detained since May with sedition and terrorism, which carry a maximum sentence of life imprisonment, his lawyer said Wednesday.

headline: Afghan Family Awaits Justice For US Drone Strike Killing 10 Of Its Members
description: An Afghan family that lost 10 members, including seven children, in a mistaken US drone strike on a Kabul home says it is still seeking justice and has yet to hear from the Americans more than two months after the tragedy.

headline: South Korea Urges COVID-19 Booster Shots As Severe Cases Hit Record High
description: South Korea encouraged its citizens to take COVID-19 booster shots on Wednesday, as more of the elderly fell ill and reported vaccine breakthrough infections, driving serious and critical cases to a record.

headline: China's Ruling Party To Wrap Up Key Meeting To Cement Xi Jinping's Power
description: China's Communist Party will wrap up a meeting on Thursday that is set to culminate with a resolution that consolidates President Xi Jinping's authority, a year before he is expected to secure a precedent-breaking third term as party leader.

headline: UK Court Blocks $4.3 Billion Lawsuit Against Google Over iPhone Tracking
description: The UK Supreme Court has blocked a planned 3.2 billion pound ($4.3 billion) British class action against Google over allegations the internet giant unlawfully tracked the personal information of millions of iPhone users.

headline: Malala Yousafzai Marries Asser Malik. Know More About Him
description: Malala Yousafzai, Nobel Laureate and activist, married Asser Malik, a Pakistani Cricket Board official, in an intimate ceremony in the UK on Tuesday.

headline: 300,000 Afghans Have Crossed Into Iran Since Taliban Takeover: Aid Group
description: As many as 4,000-5,000 Afghans have been crossing into Iran daily since the Taliban seized Kabul in August and hundreds of thousands more are expected to arrive in the coming winter, the Norwegian Refugee Council said on Wednesday.

headline: Germany Advises Against Moderna Covid Vaccine For People Under 30
description: German health authorities on Wednesday advised against the use of the Moderna coronavirus vaccine for people under 30 due to evidence of a small risk of cardiac inflammation.

headline: 3 Detained For Organising Event With 2,000 Attendees In China's Wuhan
description: Chinese police detained three people after thousands of cheering fans packed a square in Wuhan to watch a Chinese team win a major eSports world title, state media said.

headline: Vietnam Approves India's Covid Vaccine Covaxin For Emergency Use
description: Vietnam has approved India's Covaxin vaccine for emergency use, the ninth to be endorsed in the country, the country's health ministry said on Wednesday.

headline: "Bedtime Fail": New Zealand PM As Daughter Interrupts Livestream
description: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern was busy telling the nation about important revisions to Covid-19 restrictions when an unexpected voice cut in: "mummy"?

headline: UN COP26 Draft Climate Proposal Asks For Higher Emissions Pledges By 2022
description: The British hosts of the COP26 UNclimate conference in Glasgow have proposed that countries raise their ambitions to slash greenhouse gas emissions by next year in a draft political decision that will be negotiated over the next three days.

headline: US Court Overturns Historic Opioid Ruling Against Drugmaker Johnson & Johnson
description: The Oklahoma State Supreme Court on Tuesday overturned a historic decision to fine US pharmaceutical giant Johnson & Johnson $465 million for its role in the opioid crisis.

headline: France Rescues 210 Migrants Crossing Sea In Makeshift Boats To Reach UK
description: More than 200 migrants were rescued as they tried to cross the Channel in makeshift boats to reach Britain, French authorities said late Tuesday.

headline: India's Race To Vaccinate Its Villages Is Crucial For Whole World
description: One of the largest COVID-19 vaccination drives in the world, India's campaign ever since January to vaccinate its 1.4 billion citizens has hit snag after snag, held back first by shortages and then by chaotic distribution..

headline: Xi Jinping Says China Is Ready To Work With US To Manage Differences
description: China is ready to properly manage differences with the United States, President Xi Jinping has said, ahead of a virtual meeting with US.

headline: World Science Day For Peace And Development 2021: Know The Date, Theme, And Significance
description: Science has made stellar advancements in the last century. To honour the role of science in our lives, UNESCO celebrates World Science Day for Peace and Development every year to ensure people are kept up-to-date about scientific developments.

headline: From India To Nigeria, Youngsters Choose The App Route To Invest
description: There's a new generation of investors in town. They're young, they get their tips on YouTube, and they're armed with apps that make the stock markets more accessible than ever before.

headline: Afghan Matters Have "Implications For Region": India At Security Dialogue
description: The recent developments in Afghanistan have important implications not only for the people of that country but also for its neighbours and the region, NSA Ajit Doval said on Wednesday at an eight-nation dialogue hosted by India on the Afghan crisis.

headline: Dalai Lama Says He Prefers To Stay In India. Here's Why
description: Dalai Lama, Tibet's spiritual leader, when asked on Wednesday in an online news conference about visiting Taiwan, said he prefers to stay in India since relations between Taiwan and mainland China are "quite delicate.

headline: Those Vaccinated Are 16 Times Less Likely To Die From Covid: Australia Study
description: People who are fully vaccinated are 16 times less likely to end up in intensive care or to die from Covid-19 than those who aren't immunized, an Australian government study found.

headline: US Judge Rules Trump Capitol Attack Records Can Be Released To Congress
description: A US federal judge ruled Tuesday that White House records that could implicate former President Donald Trump in the January 6 attack on the US Capitol can be released to a Congressional committee investigating the violence.

headline: Australian Man, 60, Uses Pocket Knife To Fight Off Crocodile
description: A 60-year-old Australian man escaped the jaws of a large crocodile by stabbing it repeatedly in the head with his pocket knife as it dragged him into a river,

headline: 4 Lions At Singapore Zoo Test Covid Positive: Report
description: Four Asiatic lions at a Singapore zoo have tested positive for COVID-19 after coming in contact with infected staff, according to a news report.

headline: Kamala Harris, Emmanuel Macron to meet to soothe France-US tensions
description: US Vice President Kamala Harris meets with French President Emmanuel Macron on Wednesday in a further effort to mend relations with Paris after a crisis sparked by a cancelled submarines contract.

headline: Top Pak Judge Inaugurates Rebuilt Hindu Temple Destroyed By Mob: Report
description: A century-old Hindu temple, which was vandalised by an irate mob of radicals in northwest Pakistan last year, has been opened to devotees by Chief Justice Gulzar Ahmed who had ordered authorities to reconstruct it, according to a media report.

headline: China Delivers Largest, Most Advanced Warship To Pakistan: Report
description: China has delivered to Pakistan the largest and most advanced warship that Beijing has ever exported.

headline: "Megxit" Is A Misogynistic Term, Says Prince Harry
description: Prince Harry said on Tuesday that the term "Megxit," a phrase used by the British press to describe the decision by him and his wife Meghan to quit their royal duties, was a misogynistic term

headline: Original Apple Computer Built By Steve Jobs Sells For $400,000
description: An original Apple computer, hand-built by company founders Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak 45 years ago, sold for $400,000 at auction in the United States on Tuesday.

headline: Looking Forward To "Second Generation" Of Covid Vaccines: WHO Chief Scientist
description: The World Health Organization's chief scientist said Tuesday she was looking forward to the "second generation" of Covid-19 vaccines, which could include nasal sprays and oral versions.

headline: Hopes None Killed In Turkey Building Collapse As 21 Survive
description: Twenty-one people survived being buried under heavy debris when a two-storey building collapsed in eastern Turkey on Tuesday, the government said, adding that no more people were believed to be missing.

headline: France's Audrey Azoulay Re-Elected As UNESCO Chief
description: The UN cultural agency UNESCO on Tuesday re-elected France's Audrey Azoulay as its director-general for a second mandate, with the former French culture minister hailing a new confidence and unity in the organisation.

headline: Panel Probing US Capitol Riot Demands Testimony From Trump Inner Circle
description: The panel investigating the January 6 assault on the US Capitol issued a new round of subpoenas Tuesday to some of then-president Donald Trump's most senior lieutenants, including spokeswoman Kayleigh McEnany and trusted confidante Stephen Miller.

headline: Pfizer Requests US Emergency Authorisation For Covid Booster For Adults
description: Drugmakers Pfizer and BioNTech announced Tuesday they have formally submitted a request asking US officials for emergency authorization of their Covid-19 booster vaccine for people aged 18 and older.

headline: US Navy Boosts Monitoring Of Submarines After Falsified Steel Tests
description: The US Navy has stepped up monitoring of its submarines after a former metallurgist for a company that supplied steel for the vessels was found to have falsified test results.

headline: Moderna Seeks EU Approval Of Covid Vaccine For 6 To 11 Year Olds
description: Moderna has applied to the European Union's medicine regulator for approval of its Covid-19 vaccine for children aged six to 11, the US biotechnology company announced Tuesday.

headline: Australia To Set Up $740 Million Fund To Develop Low-Emissions Technology
description: Australia will set up a A$1 billion ($740 million) fund to invest in companies to develop low-emissions technology, Prime Minister Scott Morrison said on Wednesday, as the country seeks to cut carbon emissions and hit net-zero targets by 2050.

headline: Detained Afghan Pilots Leave Tajikistan On US Flight: Report
description: U.S.-trained Afghan pilots and other personnel boarded U.S.-brokered flight out of Tajikistan on Tuesday, ending a nearly three-month detention ordeal that began when they escaped there in their aircraft during the Taliban takeover, Afghan sources

headline: Joe Biden, China's Xi Jinping Meeting Planned For As Soon As Next Week: Report
description: A virtual meeting planned between U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese leader Xi Jinping will be held as soon as next week, a person briefed on the matter told Reuters.

headline: Facebook Gives Estimate Of Bullying, Harassments On Its Platforms For First Time
description: Facebook for the first time on Tuesday disclosed the prevalence of bullying and harassment on its platform, saying such content was seen between 14 and 15 times per every 10,000 views on the site in the third quarter.

headline: Social Media Users Could Disable Algorithms In New US Proposal
description: A bipartisan group of lawmakers in the U.S. House of Representatives has introduced a bill that would require internet platforms like Meta's Facebook and Alphabet's Google to allow users to see content not chosen by algorithms.

headline: Joe Biden Plans In-Person Summit With Leaders Of Canada, Mexico On November 18: Report
description: U.S. President Joe Biden is planning to host an in-person meeting with the leaders of Mexico and Canada on Nov. 18, the first of its kind in more than five years, a source in Ottawa said on Tuesday.

headline: Facebook Plans To Remove "Sensitive" Ad Targeting Options
description: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it plans to remove detailed ad targeting options that refer to "sensitive" topics, such as ads based on interactions with content around race, health, religious practices, political beliefs or sexual orientation.

headline: NASA Says US Astronaut Mission To Moon Will Wait Until 2025
description: NASA will not send an astronaut mission to the moon until 2025 at the earliest, the U.S. space agency's administrator said on Tuesday, pushing back by at least a year a timeline originally set under former President Donald Trump.

headline: "America Is Back" To Lead On Climate: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi Tells COP26
description: US congressional Democrats led by House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, eager to repair damage caused by the US withdrawal from the Paris Agreement under Donald Trump, told COP26 on Tuesday that "America is back" to lead on climate.

headline: France To Make Covid Booster Shot Mandatory For Over 65 Year Olds
description: President Emmanuel Macron said Tuesday that over 65s in France would need to show proof of a Covid-19 booster jab to get a health pass required to visit restaurants, attend cultural events and take intercity rail travel.

headline: France To Relaunch Construction Of Nuclear Reactors
description: French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday announced France would launch a drive to build new nuclear energy plants in order to better meet growing energy and environmental challenges.

headline: Malala Yousafzai Marries Pak Cricket Coach Asser In UK. See Pics
description: Nobel laureate Malala Yousafzai and her partner Asser announced their wedding on social media today.

headline: ISIS Violence Dents Taliban Claims Of Safer Afghanistan
description: Last month, the family of Mawlavi Ezzatullah, a member of Afghanistan's Hizb-e Islami party, received a WhatsApp message from his phone: "We have slaughtered your Mawlavi Ezzat, come and collect his body."

headline: WHO Warns Of Massive Syringe Shortfall In 2022
description: The World Health Organization warned Tuesday there could be shortfall of up to two billion syringes in 2022, which threatens to hamper vaccine efforts globally is production does not improve.

headline: World Heading For 2.4 Degrees Warming After Latest Climate Pledges: Report
description: New national pledges to tackle climate change this decade would lead to around 2.4 degrees Celsius of global warming this century, far above safe levels, analysts predict.

headline: European Union To Approve First Covid Antibody Drugs Amid Spike In Cases
description: The European Union drugs regulator is set to authorise the use of two monoclonal antibodies to treat COVID-19 patients in coming days, two EU sources told Reuters, in its first approvals of such therapies.

headline: UK Publisher Appeals Against Court Ruling In Meghan Markle Copyright Case
description: A UK newspaper group began a legal challenge on Tuesday over a ruling that it breached the Duchess of Sussex's privacy by publishing parts of a letter she wrote to her estranged father.

headline: France Urges "Rapid Solution" To Fishing Dispute After New Talks With UK
description: France urged Tuesday a "rapid solution" to a fishing dispute with Britain that has threatened to degenerate into a full-blown trade war, after new talks aimed at breaking weeks of deadlock.

headline: Tuvalu Minister Films Speech Thigh-Deep In Ocean To Depict Climate Change
description: Tuvalu's foreign minister has given a speech to the United Nations climate conference in Glasgow standing knee-deep in seawater to show how his low-lying Pacific island nation is on the front line of climate change.

headline: Covid Stole 28 Million Years Of Life From 31 Countries Last Year
description: The pandemic's effects on mortality have been uneven. Life expectancy dipped in most places last year, shaving 28.1 million years off the cumulative longevity in 31 countries.

headline: US Special Envoy For Afghanistan To Visit India, Pakistan
description: US special envoy for Afghanistan, Thomas West, said he plans to visit India and Pakistan as part of his upcoming trip to Europe and Asia

headline: US Supreme Court To Debate Restriction On Religious Advisors At Executions
description: The US Supreme Court will consider Tuesday a death row prisoner's request that his pastor be allowed to touch him during his execution, a case that could determine the role of religious advisors in death chambers.

headline: Facebook Unblocks '#Saltbae' Hashtag Amid Golden Steak Video Controversy
description: Facebook found the '#saltbae' tag had been blocked globally days after a video was posted online of celebrity chef Nusret Gokce (dubbed Salt Bae) feeding a gold-encrusted steak to a senior Vietnamese Communist Party official in London.

headline: Indian-Origin Malaysian's Execution Suspended In Singapore Over Covid
description: A Singapore court on Tuesday stayed the execution of a 33-year-old Indian-origin Malaysian man, convicted for drug trafficking, after he tested positive for COVID-19.

headline: Thailand To Reopen Borders To Foreign Workers Amid Labour Shortage
description: Thailand plans to reopen its borders to workers from neighbouring Myanmar, Cambodia and Laos, a government official said on Tuesday, in a bid to ease a labour shortage that is hurting its export and tourism-dependent economy.

headline: Nepal Army Chief On 4-Day India Visit To Bolster Defence Ties
description: Nepal Army chief GenPrabhu Ram Sharma on Tuesday embarked on a four-day visit to India to step up defence ties between the two neighbouring nations.

headline: Warned Off US Drones Approaching Iran Gulf Drills, Claims Iran Military
description: Iran's military warned off US drones trying to approach Iranian war games near the mouth of the Gulf, state broadcaster IRIB said on Tuesday.

headline: Twitter Flags US Republican Rep's Video On Joe Biden, Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez As Hateful Conduct
description: Twitter Inc added a warning label on Tuesday to an anime video shared by US Republican lawmaker Paul Gosar, depicting him swinging swords at President Joe Biden and killing Democratic congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez.

headline: Singapore Court Delays Disabled Man's Execution Due To Covid Infection
description: A Singapore court Tuesday postponed the imminent execution of a Malaysian man whom campaigners say is mentally disabled after he tested positive for Covid-19, meaning a last-ditch appeal could not proceed.

headline: US Judge Rules In Favour Of United Airlines In Employee Vaccine Dispute
description: A US judge ruled Monday in favor of United Airlines, which offered unpaid leave to employees who declined to receive a mandated COVID-19 vaccine on religious or medical grounds.

headline: Boat Of Drowned US Paralympian Rower Washes Up On Shore Of Pacific Island
description: The boat used by the late US Paralympian and ocean rower Angela Madsen has been found washed up on a remote Marshall Islands atoll 16 months after she drowned trying to cross the Pacific in it.

headline: China Poses "Grave" Military Threat, Can Blockade Key Harbours: Taiwan
description: China's armed forces are capable of blockading Taiwan's key harbours and airports, the island's defence ministry said on Tuesday, offering its latest assessment of what it describes as a "grave" military threat posed by its giant neighbour.

headline: Nicaragua's Daniel Ortega Secures 4th Term, US Threatens Sanctions
description: Nicaragua's President Daniel Ortega clinched a fourth consecutive term, results showed on Monday, after jailing political rivals ahead of a vote that prompted threats of sanctions from the United States and international calls for free elections.

headline: Chinese City Offers Cash For Clues To Trace Latest Covid Outbreak
description: A Covid-hit Chinese city is offering thousands of dollars for anyone giving clues in tracing the source of its latest outbreak, as part of a "people's war" to stamp out one of the country's largest resurgences in months.

headline: NASA-SpaceX Capsule Carrying 4 Astronauts Returns To Earth After 6 Months
description: Four astronauts returned to Earth Monday in a SpaceX craft after spending six months on the International Space Station, a NASA live broadcast showed, marking the end of a busy mission.

headline: "Smaller Than Parking Space": Life In Hong Kong's Microflats, Nanoflats
description: For Max Lee, a 26-year-old Hong Kong doctor, life in his single-room apartment revolves around the bed. It's the first thing you see walking in.

headline: Thousands Protest In New Zealand Against COVID-19 Vaccine Mandate
description: New Zealand beefed up security measures at its parliament on Tuesday as thousands of people gathered to protest against COVID-19 vaccine mandates and government lockdowns.

headline: January Rollout For US' First Projects To Counter China's Belt And Road
description: The United States plans to invest in five to 10 large infrastructure projects around the world in January as part of a broader Group of Seven initiative to counter China's Belt and Road Initiative, a senior U.S. official said on Monday.

headline: Apple Computer Hand-Built By Steve Jobs May Fetch Up To $600,000 At Auction
description: An original Apple computer, hand-built by company founders Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak 45 years ago, goes under the hammer in the United States on Tuesday.

headline: Teary-Eyed Family Reunions At New York Airport As US Reopens Borders
description: As soon as she spots her son Liam at New York's JFK airport, Alison Henry runs towards him and gives him a long hug, tears welling up in her eyes.

headline: US-Mexico Border Reopens After 20 Months Of Covid Shutdown
description: There were fewer crossings at the Mexico-United States border than expected on Monday as it reopened to nonessential travel following a 20-month closure due to the COVID-19 pandemic, with many residents staying home to avoid potential chaos.

headline: About 5 Million Email Addresses Exposed In Security Breach: Robinhood
description: Robinhood Markets Inc said on Monday a third party had obtained access to the email addresses of about five million of its customers.

headline: Panel Probing US Capitol Riot Issues Subpoenas To Top Trump Lieutenants
description: Lawmakers probing the deadly January 6 assault on the US Capitol issued subpoenas Monday to top aides of Donald Trump who are accused of plotting to overturn his defeat in a "war room" at a luxury Washington hotel.

headline: US To Streamline Immigration Rules For Recent Afghan Arrivals
description: The US government will streamline immigration procedures for recent Afghan arrivals to speed up their resettlement in the United States, the Department of Homeland Security said Monday.

headline: Virgin Galactic Sells Around 100 Tickets Since Richard Branson Space Trip
description: Virgin Galactic has sold around 100 tickets since flying its founder Richard Branson to space over summer, with commercial service expected to begin by the end of 2022, the company said in its financial results Monday.

headline: NASA-SpaceX Crew Begins Return Voyage From International Space Station
description: Four astronauts who arrived at the International Space Station in April for a long-duration science mission began their return voyage to Earth on Monday as their SpaceX Crew Dragon capsule separated from the orbiting laboratory for a flight home.

headline: Denmark Re-Introduces Health Pass After Sharp Rise In Covid Cases
description: Denmark will re-introduce a health pass because of a sharp rise in Covid-19 infections, Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen said Monday, less than two months after scrapping controls.

headline: At Least 26 Children Dead In Niger School Fire
description: At least 26 children aged between five and six burnt to death on Monday when their straw and wood classrooms caught fire in southern Niger, seven months after a similar tragedy in the capital Niamey.

headline: Russia Signs Contract To Develop New Heavy Helicopter With China
description: Russia has signed a contract with China to jointly develop a multipurpose heavy helicopter, state-owned Russian Helicopters said on Monday, in a sign of closer technological cooperation between Moscow and the world's no. 2 economy.

headline: Pakistan Agrees One-Month "Complete Ceasefire" With Banned Local Taliban
description: Pakistan and local Taliban militants have agreed a one-month ceasefire which may be extended if both sides agree, spokesmen said on Monday, opening the possibility of a fuller peace accord to help end years of bloodshed.

headline: Russia Declares Rights Lawyer Who Defended Kremlin Critic's Group "Foreign Agent"
description: A top Russian human rights lawyer who defended the Anti-Corruption Foundation of jailed opposition politician Alexei Navalny was added to the Justice Ministry's list of "foreign agents" on Monday.

headline: Facebook Can Pursue Malware Lawsuit Against Israel's NSO Group: US Appeals Court
description: US appeals court said Facebook can pursue a lawsuit accusing Israel's NSO Group of exploiting a bug in its WhatsApp messaging app to install malware allowing the surveillance of 1,400 people, including journalists, human rights activists and diss

headline: US Seizes $6.1 Million In Relation To Russian Ransomware Operator
description: The United States has seized $6.1 million in relation to Russian ransomware operator Yevgeniy Polyanin, top U.S. Justice Department officials said on Monday.

headline: Bill Gates Might Have Been Richer Than Musk, Bezos Combined If...
description: Bill Gates might have ended up richer than Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos combined by hanging onto Microsoft Corp. rather than selling.

headline: Pakistan Begins Talks With Banned Local Taliban, Says Minister
description: Pakistan has started talks with the domestic Taliban movement, the country's information minister said Monday, possibly paving the way for members of an organisation long branded an international terror group to surrender and be given amnesty.

headline: French Catholic Church To Settle Sexual Abuse Claims With Asset Sales
description: Catholic bishops in France agreed Monday to sell part of the Church's extensive real estate holdings to compensate thousands of victims of child sex abuse at the hands of clergy.

headline: Iran Seeks Assurance US Will "Never" Pull Out Of Nuclear Deal
description: Iran on Monday demanded US guarantees it will never again pull out of the 2015 nuclear accord and warned Tehran will not accept any partial return to the deal.

headline: Russian President, CIA Chief Discuss "Regional Conflicts": Kremlin
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin discussed regional conflicts and a crisis in ties with the head of the US Central Intelligence Agency who paid a rare trip to Moscow last week, the Kremlin said Monday.

headline: China, India Should Lead Climate Change Issue: Ex-US President Barack Obama
description: Former US President Barack Obama said Monday he understood why young people were "frustrated" with climate inaction from leaders and that "most countries have failed" to live up to promises they made in the Paris Agreement.

headline: Vatican To Lose 100 Million Pounds In London Building Sale: Report
description: The Vatican stands to lose 100 million pounds in charity donations with the sale of a London luxury building at the centre of a financial scandal, a report said Monday.

headline: Unvaccinated Covid Patients To Pay Their Own Medical Bills If Hospitalised: Singapore
description: Singapore's COVID-19 patients who remain unvaccinated by choice will have to pay for their hospitalisation bills from December 8, the government said on Monday, as it got tough on people who are still holding off from getting their jabs.

headline: Man Wanted For Attack On US Capitol Seeks Asylum In Belarus: Report
description: Belarus state television says an American charged in the US Capitol riot investigation illegally crossed into the tightly controlled ex-Soviet country and is seeking asylum.

headline: Russia Ends Week-Long Nationwide Paid Holiday Despite Spiking Covid Cases
description: Most of Russia on Monday ended a week-long paid holiday aimed at curbing the spread of the coronavirus, despite the country seeing thousands of new cases and more than 1,000 deaths per day.

headline: "Pure Fabrication", Says Beijing On US Charges Against Chinese 'Spy'
description: China on Monday labelled the charges against a Chinese citizen convicted in the United States of stealing trade secrets as "pure fabrication".

headline: Taliban Backs Polio Vaccine Campaign By WHO, UNICEF In Afghanistan
description: The World Health Organization (WHO) and the United Nations children's agency kicked off a polio vaccination campaign in Afghanistan on Monday, the first nationwide campaign to fight the disease in three years.

headline: Germany's 7-Day Covid Incidence Rate Hits Record High
description: Germany's incidence rate measuring the number of new coronavirus infections per 100,000 people over the last seven days soared to 201.1 on Monday, a record since the pandemic erupted more than a year ago.

headline: US Reopens Borders For International Travellers After Nearly 2 Years
description: Travellers across the world prepared on Monday to be reunited with loved ones in the United States for the first time in nearly two years, as restrictions were lifted to allow non-U.S citizens to fly there, provided they are vaccinated.

headline: China Struggles With Worst Covid Outbreaks Since Wuhan Origin
description: China is resolutely sticking with its zero-tolerance approach to COVID-19, even as the delta variant continues to penetrate its formidable defenses. Officials are implementing increasingly aggressive measures in an attempt to rein in the virus.

headline: Australia Says It Will Sell Coal For Decades Into The Future
description: More than 40 countries pledged to eliminate coal use within decades during the COP26 UN climate summit in Glasgow, which aims to cap the warming of Earth since the Industrial Revolution to between 1.5 and 2.0 degrees Celsius.

headline: Bodies Of 3 French Climbers Missing For 2 Weeks Found In Himalayas
description: A search team flew out to recover three bodies in a remote corner of Nepal's Himalayas on Monday, close to where a trio of French climbers went missing last month.

headline: A Speech Filmed In Sea To Show Climate Change. Courtesy: Tuvalu Minister
description: Tuvalu's foreign minister Simon Kofe has given a speech to the United Nations climate conference in Glasgow standing knee-deep in seawater to show how his low-lying Pacific island nation is on the front line of climate change.

headline: Covid Vaccine Booster Shots Roll Out For Australians As Curbs Ease
description: Australia began administering booster shots of Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine on Monday as millions of people in its largest city, Sydney, woke up to more freedom amid an accelerating immunisation drive.

headline: China Builds Mockups Of US Warships As Training Targets, Show Images
description: China's military has built mockups in the shape of a U.S. Navy aircraft carrier and other U.S. warships, possibly as training targets, in the desert of Xinjiang, satellite images by Maxar showed on Sunday.

headline: Energy Crisis In India, China That Helped Revive Coal Is Easing, For Now
description: An energy crisis in two of Asia's key economies that caused power shortages and threatened slower growth is beginning to ease, though further risks remain.

headline: US Names Envoy To Probe Mystery Illness "Havana Syndrome"
description: Antony Blinken appointed a longtime diplomat to lead investigation into dozens of cases of "Havana Syndrome," as Biden administration struggles to get to bottom of an illness.

headline: Astronaut Wang Yaping Becomes First Chinese Woman To Walk In Space
description: Astronaut Wang Yaping became the first Chinese woman to walk in space, authorities said Monday, as her team completed a six-hour stint outside the Tiangong space station as part of its ongoing construction.

headline: Japan Sees No Daily Deaths From Covid For 1st Time In 15 Months: Report
description: Japan recorded no daily deaths from COVID-19 for the first time in more than a year on Sunday, according to local media.

headline: Dress Amy Winehouse Wore For Her Last Concert Sells For $243,200
description: The dress singer Amy Winehouse wore for her final performance sold Sunday for $243,200, 16 times its estimated value, as part of a trove of memorabilia from the late diva's life auctioned in California.

headline: Rappers Travis Scott, Drake Sued Over Astroworld Concert "Crowd Mayhem"
description: Rappers Travis Scott and Drake have been sued for having "incited mayhem" after eight people were killed and dozens injured in a crush during a Texas concert, the law firm confirmed on Sunday.

headline: Slam Poet Brings Refugee Voices To COP26: "Earth Began To Purge Us Too"
description:
At COP26, Sudanese-American poet Emtithal Mahmoud
will be appealing for urgent action but also highlighting the efforts refugees are already making to adapt to their habitats.

headline: US President Joe Biden Slams Nicaragua Election As "Sham": White House
description: US President Joe Biden on Sunday slammed Nicaraguan presidential elections as a "sham," as incumbent Daniel Ortega was assured to win a fourth consecutive five-year term after sidelining his challengers.

headline: Taliban Members Are Now Governors, Police Chiefs In Afghanistan
description: The Taliban appointed 44 of its members to key roles including provincial governors and police chiefs on Sunday, a key step in shoring up its governance as the country grapples with growing security and economic problems.

headline: Twitter Users Say "Yes" To Elon Musk's Offer To Sell 10% Of Tesla Stock
description: Tesla Inc CEO Elon Musk should sell about 10% of his Tesla stock, according to 57.9% of people who voted on his Twitter poll asking users of the social media network whether he should offload the stake.

headline: Submarine Didn't Sink French Fishing Trawler In 2004, UK Probe Finds
description: A British coroner on Friday concluded that the 2004 sinking of a French fishing trawler in UK waters, which killed five people, was an accident, rejecting claims it had been dragged down by a submarine.

headline: Global COVID-19 Cases Near 250 Million As Delta Variant Surge Eases
description: Worldwide cases due to COVID-19 were approaching 250 million on Sunday as the surge from the Delta variant eases and more normal trade and tourism resume, although some countries in eastern Europe are experiencing record outbreaks.

headline: Shoaib Akhtar Gets Rs 100 Million Defamation Notice By Pak Channel: Report
description: Pakistan Television Corporation (PTV) has sent a Rs 100 million defamation notice to the country's former pacer Shoaib Akhtar on Sunday stating that the latter had resigned on air from PTV sports last month which is not only a violation of the clause

headline: Japan Eases Border Rules For Business Travellers, Students Amid Pandemic
description: Japan said Friday it will allow short-term business travellers, foreign students and other visa holders to enter the country, but tourists are still barred under pandemic border restrictions.

headline: White House Defends US Vaccine Mandate Against Court Challenge
description: US President Joe Biden's administration on Sunday issued a vocal defense of a controversial Covid-19 vaccine mandate for large companies despite a court challenge that temporarily freezes the program.

headline: US Finally Reopening Borders After 20 Months For Fully Vaccinated Travelers
description: The United States reopens its land and air borders Monday to foreign visitors fully vaccinated against Covid-19, ending 20 months of restrictions on travel from around the globe that separated families, hobbled tourism and strained diplomatic ties.

headline: Massive Whale Dies After Getting Stranded In Northern France
description: French animal experts said on Sunday they were preparing to conduct an autopsy on a 19-metre-long whale that died after getting stranded at the northern port of Calais.

headline: NASA To Bring Astronauts From Space On Monday As High Winds Delay Return
description: Four astronauts are scheduled to return to Earth from the International Space Station early Monday after spending more than six months in space, NASA announced.

headline: British Sikh Female Army Officer Harpreet Chandi Sets Off For South Pole Adventure
description: A 32-year-old British Sikh Army officer and physiotherapist is on a mission to become the first Indian-origin female to complete a solo, unsupported trek to the South Pole and is flying out to Chile on Sunday to begin her adventure.

headline: Taliban Orders Taxi Drivers To Not Transport Other Gunmen: Report
description: The Taliban has ordered the taxi drivers of the eastern Nangarhar province not to transport any other gunmen other than the ones who are the Taliban affiliates.

headline: China's Delivery Drivers Live On Edge Amid Exploitative Sector Practices
description: Handing over a piping hot meal at exactly the time promised, Chinese food delivery driver Zhuang Zhenhua triumphantly tapped his job as complete through the Meituan app -- and was immediately fined half of his earnings.

headline: Australia's Sydney To Further Ease Covid Restrictions As Vaccinations Pick Up
description: Australia's largest city of Sydney will further ease social distancing curbs on Monday, a month after emerging from a coronavirus lockdown that lasted nearly 100 days, as close to 90 per cent of people have got both doses of vaccine.

headline: Amid Climate Crisis, Nuclear Power Finally Has "Seat At Table": UN Agency
description: For more than two decades, promoters and purveyors of nuclear energy felt shunned at UN climate change conferences. At the COP26 summit underway in Glasgow, however, they have been welcomed with open arms, the UN's top nuclear regulator told AFP.

headline: Airlines Brace For Travel Surge As US Reopens For All Vaccinated Voyagers
description: Airline reservations to the United States took off immediately after the White House announced the country would reopen to all vaccinated international voyagers starting next week, compelling a welcome -- if challenging -- industry pivot.

headline: 2 Suspects Arrested In Mexico Beach Shooting That Left 2 Dead
description: Mexican authorities on Saturday arrested two people suspected of involvement in a shooting between rival gangs on a beach near the Caribbean resort destination of Cancun that left two people dead.

headline: Changing Guard At Buckingham Palace: Prince Charles' Wife Camilla Steps Up
description: A gradual changing of the guard is happening at the head of Britain's royal family, as Queen Elizabeth II steps back from public engagements due to her advanced age and health.

headline: "Apparent Act Of Terrorism": US Condemns Attack On Iraq Prime Minister
description: The United States on Saturday condemned a drone attack on Iraqi Prime Minister Mustafa al-Kadhimi, which it characterized as an "apparent act of terrorism."

headline: 19 Dead, 3 Injured As Cargo Truck Crashes Into 6 Vehicles In Mexico
description: At least 19 people were killed and three injured Saturday in an accident on the highway that connects Mexico City with the central city of Puebla, authorities said.

headline: French Bishops Kneel In Penance For Decades Of Child Sex Abuse By Church
description: Senior members of France's Catholic hierarchy knelt in a show of penance at the shrine of Lourdes Saturday, a day after bishops accepted the church's responsibility for decades of child abuse.

headline: "Attempted Assassination": Explosives-Laden Drone Targets Iraq PM's House
description: A drone laden with explosives targeted the residence of Iraq's Prime Minister Mustafa al-Kadhimi in Baghdad early on Sunday in what the Iraqi military called an attempted assassination, but said Kadhimi escaped unhurt.

headline: Brazil Bids Shocked Goodbye To Latin Grammy-Winning Star Marilia Mendonca
description: Thousands of people flooded the hometown of late Brazilian country music star Marilia Mendonca Saturday, paying an emotional tribute to the beloved songstress of sorrow and strong women after she was killed in a plane crash at age 26.

headline: Israel Suggests US Open Consulate For Palestinians In West Bank, Not Jerusalem
description: Israel stepped up its public opposition on Saturday to a plan by President Joe Biden's administration to reopen a U.S. consulate for Palestinians in Jerusalem, suggesting such a mission should be in the occupied West Bank.

headline: North Korean Troops Stage Artillery Fire Competition
description: North Korean mechanized troops held an artillery fire competition over the weekend as part of efforts to boost the country's defence capabilities, state media reported on Sunday

headline: Israel Distances Itself From Blacklisted Pegasus Spyware Maker NSO
description: Israel's Foreign Minister Yair Lapid on Saturday distanced the government from the NSO Group, a firm blacklisted this week by the United States over alleged misuse of its phone hacking spyware.

headline: Elon Musk Leaves Fate Of His $21 Billion Tesla Stock On Twitter Poll
description: Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk on Saturday asked his 62.5 million followers on Twitter in a poll if he should sell 10 per cent of his Tesla stock.

headline: "Words Not Enough": Protesters Demand Climate Action In Global Rally
description: Tens of thousands of protesters braved rain and wind in Glasgow Saturday as part of worldwide demonstrations against what campaigners say is a failure of crunch UN climate talks to act fast enough to tame global warming.

headline: 21 Brazil Scientists Refuse Medals In Row With Jair Bolsonaro
description: Twenty-one scientists awarded one of Brazil's highest honors, the National Order of Scientific Merit, rejected their medals Saturday after President Jair Bolsonaro withdrew two colleagues whose work apparently discomfited his government from the lis

headline: US Court Blocks Joe Biden Vaccine Mandate For Businesses
description: A US federal appeals court Saturday froze a vaccine mandate by President Joe Biden's administration that is intended to push workers at businesses with more than 100 employees into getting Covid-19 shots.

headline: Pakistan Removes Ban On Radical Group After Deadly Protests
description: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Saturday gave his permission to remove the extremist group Tehreek-i-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP) from the list of banned outfits, succumbing to the hardline Islamists to end the deadly anti-government agitation.

headline: Greece Imposes New Curbs For Unvaccinated As Covid Cases Rise
description: Queues formed outside shops in Athens on Saturday on the first day of new restrictions to curb soaring coronavirus infections which require the unvaccinated to have negative COVID-19 tests.

headline: Joe Biden Backs Compensation To Families Separated At Border In Trump Era
description: US President Joe Biden said Saturday he supported compensation for families of immigrants separated from their children at the Mexican border under the "zero tolerance" policy of Donald Trump.

headline: Iran Sentences Pair To Death For Adultery: Report
description: Iran's supreme court has upheld death sentences for adultery against a 27-year-old and his 33-year-old lover after the man's father-in-law denied them clemency, a reformist newspaper reported Saturday.

headline: India, France Agree To Expand Defence, Security Partnership At Strategic Meet
description: In a significant move, India and France agreed to strengthen defence and security partnership by enhancing intelligence and information sharing and bolstering mutual capabilities.

headline: Pentagon Report Flags China's "Dual-Use Biological Activities"
description: China has engaged in biological activities with potential dual-use applications, which raise concerns regarding its compliance with the Biological and Toxins Weapons Convention (BWC) and the Chemical Weapons Convention, the Pentagon said.

headline: Baby Handed To US Troops In Kabul Airlift Chaos Still Missing: Report
description: Mirza Ali Ahmadi and his wife Suraya found themselves and their five children on August19 in a chaotic crowd outside the gates of the Kabul airport in Afghanistan when a USsoldier, from over the tall fence, asked if they needed help.

headline: 2000-Year-Old "Slave Room" Discovered In Ancient Italian City
description: Pompeii archaeologists said Saturday they have unearthed the remains of a "slave room" in an exceptionally rare find at a Roman villa destroyed by Mount Vesuvius' eruption nearly 2,000 years ago.

headline: Russia Reports Highest-Ever Daily Covid Count Despite Paid Holiday
description: Russia on Saturday reported a record number of daily coronavirus cases as the country reaches the end of a nationwide paid holiday introduced to curb the spread of infections.

headline: 4 Women, Including Activist, Killed In Afghanistan: Taliban
description: Four women have been killed in the northern city of Mazar-i-Sharif, a spokesman for Afghanistan's Taliban government said on Saturday, as local sources identified at least one of the victims as a rights activist.

headline: 3 Injured In Knife Attack On Train In Germany
description: Three people were wounded in a knife attack on a high-speed train in southern Germany on Saturday, local police said, adding a suspect had been arrested.

headline: 98 Dead In Fuel Tanker Blast In Sierra Leone Capital
description: A massive explosion at a petrol station in Sierra Leone's capital Freetown has killed 92 people, the country's vice president said on Saturday.

headline: New Zealand Crosses 200 Daily Covid Cases For First Time In Pandemic
description: New Zealand's 206 new daily community infections on Saturday carried it past the double-hundred mark for the first time during the coronavirus pandemic, as the nation scrambles to vaccinate its population of 5 million.

headline: The Era Of Anti-Covid Pills: What You Need To Know
description: US pharma giants Merck and Pfizer have announced encouraging results for oral aniviral pills, in what could open up a new chapter in the fight against the COVID-19 pandemic.

headline: 8 Die, Many Injured At US Rapper Travis Scott's Concert Amid Crowd Surge
description: A crush triggered by a crowd surging toward the stage at a Travis Scott rap concert in Texas left at least eight people dead and others wounded amid scenes of chaos and panic, authorities said Saturday.

headline: "Magnificent Milestone": Scott Morrison Lauds Australia For Hitting 80% Vaccination
description: Australia reached on Saturday a full inoculation rate of 80 per cent of those aged 16 and older, which Prime Minister Scott Morrison called a "magnificent milestone" on the path to becoming one of the world's most vaccinated countries against Covid.

headline: China Threatens Taiwan Separatists With Lifelong Criminal Liability
description: China will hold those who support "Taiwan independence" criminally liable for life, it said on Friday, provoking anger and ridicule from the democratic island at a time of heightened tension across the sensitive Taiwan Strait.

headline: China Successfully Launches 3 New Remote Sensing Satellites Into Space
description: China on Saturday successfully launched three new remote sensing satellites from the Xichang Satellite Launch Centre in the country's southwestern Sichuan province, official media reported.

headline: Joe Biden's $1.2 Trillion Infrastructure Bill Passed Amid Approval Slump
description: Democrats rescued President Joe Biden's faltering domestic agenda Friday, passing a giant infrastructure package that is one of the pillars of his $3 trillion economic vision.

headline: China Ruling Party Meet Next Week To Set Tone For Xi's Long-Term Rule
description: From Monday to Thursday, some 400 members of the Communist Party's all-powerful Central Committee gather in Beijing behind closed doors, in a meeting that is widely expected to hand Chinese leader Xi Jinping a third term in office.

headline: US Offers $5 Million Prize For Information On El Chapo-Linked Drug Lords
description: The US State Department announced Friday it would offer up to $5 million each for information that would help authorities capture and convict four Mexican drug cartel kingpins, including the brother of infamous trafficker "El Chapo."

headline: Fear Stalks Rohingya Refugee Camps In Bangladesh After String Of Murders
description: Bloodstains still mark the spot where assassins gunned down Mohib Ullah, an activist who was a leading voice for the 850,000 Rohingya living in fear in Bangladeshi refugee camps.

headline: FC Barcelona Confirms Return Of Club Icon Xavi Hernandez As Head Coach
description: FC Barcelona confirmed the return of Xavi Hernandez as coach on Saturday, adding that the legendary midfielder was expected back in the city this weekend to take up his new role, and begin restoring the fallen Spanish giants to their former glory.

headline: Dress From Amy Winehouse's Last Concert To Go Up For Auction This Weekend
description: The dress that singer Amy Winehouse wore for her final performance will be auctioned this weekend in California, as part of a trove of memorabilia from the soul diva's life.

headline: "It's Our Lives On The Line": Young Activists Tell UN Climate Talks
description: Thousands of young campaigners marched through the streets of Glasgow on Friday, demanding urgent action from world leaders at the U.N. climate conference to stave off catastrophic climate change.

headline: US Rapper Fetty Wap Gets Bail In Drug Trafficking Case
description: US rapper Fetty Wap was released on bail Friday, New York prosecutors said, a week after he was charged with drug trafficking.

headline: Latin Grammy-Winning Singer Marilia Mendonca Dies In Brazil Plane Crash
description: Marilia Mendonca, one of the hottest young stars of Brazil's answer to country music, died in a plane crash on Friday, officials said.

headline: Skeletal Remains Solve 4-Decade-Old Missing German Skier Case In US
description: The four-decade-old mystery of a German skier who vanished in the Never Summer Mountains appeared to have been solved with the discovery of skeletal remains, US authorities said this week.

headline: Chinese Spy Convicted Of Plotting To Steal US Aviation Trade Secrets
description: A spy for the Chinese Ministry of State Security has been convicted by a federal jury of plotting to steal trade secrets from several U.S. aviation and aerospace companies, the Justice Department said on Friday.

headline: Joe Biden Bid To Revive American Dream Hinges On Divided Congress
description: Rekindling the American Dream of prosperity as a balm for a bruised and battered nation is the risky bet on which Joe Biden is doubling down, with his grand investment vision hanging in the balance in a divided Congress.

headline: Actor George Clooney Asks Media Not To Publish His Kids' Photos
description: Oscar-winning actor George Clooney has called on media not to publish pictures of his children, to avoid putting them in danger.

headline: Rebel Democrats Block Vote On Sweeping Joe Biden Welfare Package
description: Democrats failed to overcome an 11th-hour revolt on US President Joe Biden's sweeping $3 trillion transport, welfare and climate agenda, as a small group of lawmakers blocked any chance of the entire package passing Friday.

headline: US Navy Names Ship After Assassinated Gay Rights Icon Harvey Milk
description: One of the first openly gay politicians in the United States, who was assassinated four decades ago, will have a ship named after him this weekend, as the US military looks to keep step with modern-day social attitudes.

headline: Bharat Biotech's Covaxin Approval Requested In US For Children Below 18
description: US company Ocugen announced Friday that it had asked authorities for emergency use authorization for Covid-19 vaccine Covaxin, which was developed in India, for ages 2 to 18.

headline: US To Convene Foreign Ministers On COVID-19 On Nov 10
description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Friday he would convene a virtual meeting of foreign ministers from around the globe to discuss the COVID-19 pandemic next week, pledging to work to address global inequalities in access to vaccines.

headline: Afghan Baby Handed To US Soldiers In Airlift Chaos Still Missing: Report
