description: It was a split second decision. Mirza Ali Ahmadi and his wife Suraya found themselves and their five children on Aug. 19 in a chaotic crowd outside the gates of the Kabul airport in Afghanistan when a U.S. soldier, from over the tall fence, asked if

headline: Alpha Covid Variant Detected In Dogs, Cats: Report
description: A new study in the Veterinary Record reveals that pets can be infected with the alpha variant of SARS-CoV-2, which was first detected in southeast England and is commonly known as the UK variant or B.1.1.7.

headline: Amazon Seeks US Approval To Deploy 4,500 Addditonal Satellites For Internet Project
description: Amazon.com is seeking approval from U.S. communications regulators to deploy more than 4,500 additional satellites as part of the company's effort to deliver broadband internet to areas around the world that lack high-speed service.

headline: 1 Killed, 125 Injured As Iraq Police Clash With Pro-Iran Protesters
description: Hundreds of supporters of pro-Iran groups clashed with security forces in Iraq's capital on Friday, leaving more than 100 people injured as they vented their fury over last month's election result.

headline: Greta Thunberg Calls COP26 Climate Summit "A Failure"
description: Swedish campaigner Greta Thunberg on Friday branded the UN climate summit in Glasgow a "failure" after a week of negotiations produced what some experts have called vague promises to cut emissions.

headline: US To Sell Advanced Air-To-Air Missiles To Saudi Arabia
description: The US State Department announced the approval Thursday of the sale of $650 million worth of air-to-air missiles to Saudi Arabia to help the country protect itself from drone attacks.

headline: US Urges Americans In Ethiopia To Leave 'As Soon As Possible'
description: The United States on Friday urged Americans in Ethiopia to leave without delay, as fears mount of Tigrayan rebel fighters advancing on the capital Addis Ababa.

headline: Don't Press The Emergency Brexit Button: European Union Warns Britain
description: The European Union said on Friday that Britain had made no move to seek a compromise on post-Brexit trade with Northern Ireland and cautioned London against triggering emergency unilateral provisions in the Brexit deal.

headline: 1,000 Earths Could Fit In Jupiter's Red Spot Storm, NASA Juno Probe Shows
description: Data from NASA's Juno spacecraft is providing a deeper understanding of Jupiter's wondrous and violent atmosphere including its Great Red Spot, finding that this immense swirling storm extends much further down than expected.

headline: Why Even Countries With Successful Vaccine Rate Are Struggling With Delta
description: People inoculated against COVID-19 are just as likely to spread the delta variant of the virus to contacts in their household as those who haven't had shots, according to new research.

headline: Life Expectancy In India Dropped By 2 Years Due To COVID-19: Study
description: COVID-19, which has affected the lives of people worldwide, has also caused a drop in the life expectancy in India by almost two years, a statistical analysis by scientists of the city-based International Institute for Population Studies (IIPS) said.

headline: COVID-19 Vaccines May Protect Against Other Coronaviruses Too: Study
description: COVID-19 vaccines and prior coronavirus infections can provide broad immunity against other, similar coronaviruses, according to a study.

headline: 2021 Covid Outbreak In Delhi Shows Herd Immunity Against Delta Variant Difficult: Study
description: The severe outbreak of COVID-19 in Delhi this year showed that the Delta variant of SARS-CoV-2 can infect previously exposed people through a different variant of the coronavirus, highlighting the challenges of reaching herd immunity against it.

headline: Alzheimer's Disease And COVID-19 Share Genetic Risk Factor, Says UK Study
description: Scientists have identified a gene that impacts the risk of both Alzheimer's disease and severe COVID-19, a finding that could pave the way for new targets for drug development for both the diseases.

headline: Pfizer Vaccine Highly Effective Against COVID-19 Hospitalisations For 6 Months: Lancet Study
description: Two doses of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine are 90 per cent effective against hospitalisation from the disease for all variants, including Delta, for at least six months, according to a study published in The Lancet journal on Tuesday.

headline: ISRO Planning "Next Generation" Astronomy Satellite, Says Top Space Agency Official
description: The Indian Space Research Organisation is exploring the possibility of developing a next-generation astronomy satellite, a top official from the space agency has indicated.

headline: New Drug Combination Found Effective Against COVID-19 Infection: Study
description: A new drug combination can suppress infection by the S-CoV-2 virus, which causes COVID-19, according to a study conducted in animals and cell cultures.

headline: New Discovery About Immune "Sentinel" Cells May Aid In Cancer Treatment
description: Researchers during a recent study made a surprise discovery about how immune ''sentinel'' cells are maintained, which could have implications for drugs in development for cancer treatment.

headline: COVID-19 May Be Linked To Risk Of Rare Disorder Causing Paralysis: Study
description: Infection with the virus that causes COVID-19 may be associated with risk of developing Guillain-Barre syndrome, a rare disorder in which a person's immune system attacks the nerves, causing muscle weakness and occasionally paralysis, a study says.

headline: Severe COVID-19 Can Lead To Delirium, US Study Finds
description: A study of 150 patients hospitalised for COVID in the US at the beginning of the pandemic found that 73 per cent had delirium, a serious disturbance in mental state wherein a person is confused, agitated and unable to think clearly.

headline: Inhibiting Targets Of Covid Virus Proteases Can Block Infection, Shows Study
description: Researchers at the University of Liverpool have shown how SARS-CoV-2 viral proteases attack the host cell, and how this can be targeted to stop virus replication in cell culture using existing drugs.

headline: 2 Space Technology Startups Get Access To ISRO Facilities. What They Plan To Test
description: The Department of Space (DoS) has entered into a Framework MoU with aerospace startup Agnikul Cosmos for access to ISRO facilities and expertise towards the development and testing of subsystems/systems of space launch vehicles.

headline: EU Lawmakers Seek To Intensify Efforts To Protect Animals Used In Scientific Research
description: The European Parliament on Thursday asked the European Union to intensify efforts to stop using animals for scientific research.

headline: New Artificial Intelligence Tool Can Help Treat COVID-19 Patients Globally: Study
description: A team of international researchers has developed an artificial intelligence (AI) tool that can predict how much extra oxygen a COVID-19 patient might need during hospital care.

headline: COVID-19 Vaccine May Have Link With Menstrual Changes, Must Be Investigated: Study
description: A link between changes in the menstrual cycle and COVID-19 vaccination is plausible, and must be investigated, according to an editorial published in the peer-reviewed British Medical Journal today.

headline: 6 Feet Distance May Not Be Enough To Prevent Virus Spread Indoors: Study
description: Physical distancing of two metres - about six and a half feet - may not be enough to sufficiently prevent transmission of virus-carrying airborne aerosols indoors, according to a study.

headline: Scientists Unravel Mystery Behind Odisha's Rare, Endemic 'Black Tigers'
description: The enduring mystery behind the 'black tigers' of Similipal in Odisha may finally have been resolved with researchers identifying a single mutation in a gene that causes their distinctive stripes to broaden and spread into their tawny pelt.

headline: NASA's $10 Billion Space Telescope To Launch In December
description: The James Webb Space Telescope, which astronomers hope will herald a new era of discovery, will launch on December 18, NASA said Wednesday.

headline: Animals "Shape-Shifting" To Adapt To Climate Change, New Study Shows
description: Some animals are "shape-shifting" and have developed bigger tails, beaks and ears to regulate their body temperatures as the planet warms, according to a new study.

headline: Northwest, Central, South-Central India New Heatwave Hotspots, Says Study
description: Northwestern, central and south-central India are new hotspots of intense heatwave over the past 50 years, a study has said.

headline: "I've Got It," Says NASA After Mars Rover Collects Its First Rock Sample
description: NASA confirmed Monday that its Perseverance Mars rover succeeded in collecting its first rock sample for scientists to pore over when a future mission eventually brings it back to Earth.

headline: Robots To Patrol Singapore Streets To Detect Bad Social Behaviour
description: Singapore has started trials of robots to patrol public areas and deter poor social behaviour, in its latest effort to further augment its strong portfolio of surveillance tools.

headline: NASA Believes Mars Rover Succeeded In Taking Rock Sample
description: NASA's Perseverance rover succeeded in its second attempt to scoop up a piece of Martian rock for future analysis by scientists on Earth -- probably.

headline: MMR, Tdap Vaccines Linked With Increased Protection Against Severe COVID-19: Study
description: The Measles-Mumps-Rubella (MMR) and Tetanus-Diphtheria-Pertussis (Tdap) vaccines have been associated with increased protection against COVID-19 and reduction in severity of the disease, according to a study.

headline: Monoclonal Antibody Treatment Combo Cuts Hospitalisation Among High-Risk Covid Patients: Study
description: A combination of 2 monoclonal antibody treatments keeps high-risk Covid patients out of the hospital when infected with mild to moderate disease, according to an observational study published in The Lancet's EClinicalMedicine journal.

headline: COVID-19 Has More Blood Clot Threat Than Vaccines, Says UK Study: Report
description: A coronavirus infection presents a much higher risk of developing a blood clot than the first dose of either the Oxford/AstraZeneca or the Pfizer/BioNTech jab, a large study led by the University of Oxford said on Friday.

headline: Indian Researchers Spot Rare Triple Black Hole System In Nearby Universe
description: In a rare occurrence, a merger of three supermassive black holes from as many galaxies in our nearby universe was spotted by a team of Indian researchers, said the Ministry of Science and Technology.

headline: India, UK COVID-19 Study Sets Guinness World Record: Report
description: A Covid study led by UK experts and conducted at Indian hospitals among others around the world has been awarded the 'Guinness World Records' title for the world's largest scientific collaboration, involving over 140,000 patients in 116 countries.

headline: COVID-19 Most Transmissible 2 Days Before, 3 Days After Symptoms Appear: Study
description: People infected with theS-CoV-2 virus, which causes COVID-19, are most contagious two days before, and three days after they develop symptoms, according to a study conducted in China.

headline: Breast Milk Of Vaccinated Mothers Contains Antibodies That Fight COVID-19: Study
description: The breast milk of nursing mothers who have received the COVID-19 vaccine contains a significant supply of antibodies that may help protect nursing infants from the illness, according to a study.

headline: Rain On Greenland Ice Sheet, Possibly A First, Signals Climate Change Risk
description: Rain fell at the highest point on Greenland's ice sheet -- possibly for the first time -- in an event Danish scientists on Monday said was most likely driven by climate change.

headline: Pregnant Women Don't Experience More Severe Symptoms After Covid Vaccine Jab: Study
description: Pregnant and nursing women who receive the COVID-19 vaccine do not experience symptoms any more severe than their non-pregnant counterparts, according to a survey over 17,000 individuals.

headline: Delta Variant Unable To Evade Antibodies Elicited By Covid Vaccine: Study
description: The Delta variant of the SARS-CoV-2 virus, that causes COVID-19, is unable to evade the antibodies generated by vaccination, according to a lab study.

headline: Blood Clotting May Be Root Cause Of Long COVID-19 Syndrome: Study
description: Patients with long COVID-19 syndrome continue to have higher measures of blood clotting, which may explain their persistent symptoms such as reduced physical fitness and fatigue, according to a study.

headline: New Covid Vaccine Mimics Virus Shape To Provide Robust Protection: Study
description: Scientists have developed a protein-based COVID-19 vaccine candidate that mimics the shape of the virus to trigger robust antibody response in animals.

headline: COVID-19 May Become A Mostly Childhood Disease In Few Years: Study
description: COVID-19 may behave like other common-cold coronaviruses in the next few years, affecting mostly young children who have not yet been vaccinated or exposed to the virus, according to a modelling study published on Thursday.

headline: Global Eradication Of COVID-19 More Feasible Than For Polio: Study
description: The global eradication of COVID-19 is more feasible than it is for polio, but considerably less so than it was for smallpox, according to an analysis published in the journal BMJ Global Health on Tuesday.

headline: SARS-CoV-2 Antibodies Remain Stable Or Increase 7 Months After Infection: Study
description: The levels of IgG antibodies against SARS-CoV-2 remain stable, or even increase, seven months after infection, according to a study of healthcare workers published in the journal Nature Communications on Friday.

headline: Scientists From 4 BRICS Nations Come Together To Study COVID-19's Future Spread
description: Scientists from India, China, Russia and Brazil will carry out genomic sequencing of the novel coronavirus, and also studies on epidemiology and mathematical modelling of the COVID-19 pandemic, a statement said on Friday.

headline: Influenza Vaccine May Protect Against Severe Effects Of COVID-19: Study
description: The annual influenza vaccine may reduce the risk of stroke, sepsis, blood clots and several other severe effects in patients with COVID-19, according to the largest study of its kind.

headline: World's First Re-progammable Commercial Satellite Ready To Launch
description: The European Space Agency will on Friday launch the world's first commercial fully re-programmable satellite, paving the way for a new era of more flexible communications.

headline: NASA's Hubble Telescope Finds Evidence Of Water Vapour In Jupiter's Moon
description: Astronomers have uncovered the first evidence of water vapour in the atmosphere of Jupiter's moon Ganymede by using new and archival datasets from NASA's Hubble Space Telescope.

headline: Pfizer, AstraZeneca Vaccine Antibody Levels May Decline In 2-3 Months: Lancet Study
description: Total antibody levels start to wane six weeks after complete immunisation with Pfizer and AstraZeneca vaccines, and can reduce by more than 50 per cent over 10 weeks, according to study published in The Lancet journal.

headline: Single Dose Of Sputnik V COVID-19 Vaccine Triggers Strong Antibody Response: Study
description: A single dose of the Sputnik V vaccine may be enough to elicit strong antibody response against SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19, in already infected people, according to a study.

headline: Watch: Russia Military Service Dogs Take Parachute Training
description: Technodinamika, a Russian aviation holding company, shared the video on their social media pages.

headline: Mutations Help This Coronavirus Variant Evade COVID-19 Vaccines: Study
description: Three mutations in the spike protein of Epsilon variant of SARS-CoV-2 help the virus to evade the protection offered by current vaccines or past COVID-19 infection, according to a study.

headline: Novel Face Mask Developed By MIT, Harvard Can Detect COVID-19 Infection
description: Researchers at MIT and Harvard University have designed a new face mask that can diagnose if the wearer is infected with SARS-CoV-2, the virus which causes COVID-19, within 90 minutes.

headline: Chinese Covid Vaccine Safe, Effective In Children, Adolescents: Lancet Study
description: Two doses of the China-made COVID-19 vaccine, CoronaVac, are safe and produce a strong antibody response among children and adolescents aged 3-17 years, according to a study published in The Lancet Infectious Diseases journal.

headline: US University Developing Face Masks That Can Detect Covid Infection
description: Tiny sensors incorporated into wearable fabrics like masks and jackets could provide instant information on exposure to disease-causing pathogens such as the coronavirus, according to research published on Monday in the journal Nature Biotechnology.

headline: "Nesher Ramla Homo": New Type Of Early Human Found In Israel
description: Israeli researchers said Thursday they had found bones belonging to a "new type of early human" previously unknown to science, shedding new light on the course of human evolution.

headline: Method Found To Accurately Detect COVID-19 From Mobile Phone Swabs: Study
description: Researchers have developed a non-invasive and low-cost method that can accurately and rapidly detect COVID-19 using samples taken from the screens of smartphones.

headline: Pfizer, Moderna COVID-19 Vaccines Do Not Lower Sperm Count: Study
description: COVID-19 vaccines by Pfizer and Moderna do not harm male fertility, suggests a study which found the levels of sperm in participants remained at healthy levels after they got two doses of the mRNA preventive.

headline: 2 COVID-19 Vaccines For Young Children Show Promise In Early Trials: Study
description: The Moderna COVID-19 vaccine and an experimental protein-based preventive proved to be safe and showed good antibody response against SARS-CoV-2 in a trial on baby rhesus macaques, scientists say.

headline: Exposure To Common Cold Virus May Protect From COVID-19: Study
description: Exposure to the virus that causes common cold can provide protection against infection by the SARS-CoV-2 virus behind COVID-19, according to a study.

headline: Aerosol Particles Below 3 Nanometres Can Reach Sizes Having Climatic Impacts: Study
description: Scientists are researching on the concentration, size and evolution of aerosol particles smaller than 3 nanometres at an urban location in India.

headline: AstraZeneca COVID-19 Vaccine Linked With Small Risk Of Low Blood Platelets: Study
description: The Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine, also known as Covishield, may be associated with a very small risk of developing a blood condition characterised by low platelet counts, according to a nationwide study in the UK.

headline: US Intel Report On UFOs Inconclusive But Couldn't Rule Out Aliens Existence
description: The conclusion of a classified US intelligence report on the existence of alien UFOs is . . . inconclusive, US media reported Friday.

headline: Pfizer Far Less Effective For Delta Variant Than Earlier Strains: Lancet Study
description: People who got Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine are likely to have more than 5 times lower levels of neutralising antibodies against Delta variant first identified in India compared to original strain, according to research published in The Lancet journal.

headline: NASA Announces Two New Missions To Venus
description: NASA announced two new missions to Venus on Wednesday that will launch at the end of the decade and are aimed at learning how Earth's nearest planetary neighbor became a hellscape while our own thrived.

headline: World May Breach 1.5 Celsius Warming Within 5 Years: UN Climate Body
description: The World Meteorological Organization and Britain's Met Office predicted that there is a 90 percent chance of at least one year between 2021-2025 being the hottest on record.

headline: "Time To Peer Into The Universe": NASA's Stunning Image Of Galaxy Cluster
description: US space agency NASA shared a stunning glimpse of a galaxy cluster as it posted an image by itsHubble Telescope. The image features the galaxy cluster ACO S 295, which is 3.5 billion light-years away from the Earth

headline: New COVID-19 Testing Method Gives Result In 1 Second, Say Scientists: Report
description: Scientists have developed a novel sensor system that can detect the novel coronavirus from saliva samples in one second, which is way faster than current COVID-19 diagnostic methods.

headline: US Space Probe Osiris-Rex Heads Home With Asteroid Dust
description: The US space probe Osiris-Rex on Monday left the orbit of the asteroid Bennu, from which it collected dust samples last year, to begin its long journey back to Earth.

headline: Since 2010, Amazon Forest Emitted More CO2 Than It Absorbed, Says Study
description: The Brazilian Amazon released nearly 20 percent more carbon dioxide into the atmosphere over the last decade than it absorbed, according to a stunning report

headline: A Black Hole Dubbed 'The Unicorn' May Be Galaxy's Smallest One
description: Scientists have discovered what may be the smallest-known black hole in the Milky Way galaxy and the closest to our solar system - an object so curious that they nicknamed it 'the Unicorn.'

headline: In A First, NASA's Perseverance Rover Makes Oxygen On Mars
description: NASA's Perseverance rover keeps making history. The six-wheeled robot has converted some carbon dioxide from the Martian atmosphere into oxygen, the first time this has happened on another planet, the space agency said Wednesday.

headline: Crewed SpaceX Flight Postponed By A Day Due To Weather: NASA
description: A crewed SpaceX mission to the International Space Station has been postponed by a day due to concerns over the weather, NASA said Wednesday.

headline: NASA Chooses SpaceX To Take Humans Back To Moon
description: NASA has selected SpaceX to land the first astronauts on the surface of the Moon since 1972, the agency said Friday, in a huge victory for Elon Musk's company.

headline: How To Define COVID-19 Re-Infection: Indian Scientists Explain In Study
description: Two positive tests at an interval of at least 102 days with one interim negative test have been defined as SARS-CoV-2 re-infection or relapse of COVID-19 by Indian scientists for establishing surveillance systems, according to a study by ICMR.

headline: Comet 'Most Pristine' Object From Outer Space Seen In Solar System
description: A newly observed interstellar comet is the most pristine visitor from outer space ever seen in our Solar System, according to a pair of studies released Tuesday detailing its unique characteristics.

headline: SpaceX Starship Rocket Fails To Land After Test Launch
description: SpaceX chief Elon Musk confirmed on Twitter Tuesday that the latest prototype of the company's Starship rocket series had crashed, after the video feed of its test flight cut out.

headline: Vaccines May Need Regular Updates As Coronavirus Evolves, Say Scientists
description: Scientists have assessed the course of evolution of the novel coronavirus and predicted that COVID-19 vaccines currently in use across the world may need regular updates to counter new variants of the virus which are capable of escaping the body's protective antibodies.

headline: COVID-19 Antibodies May Last From Days To Years: Study Shows What It Depends On
description: Antibodies against the novel coronavirus wane at different rates, lasting for mere days in some individuals, while persisting in others for decades, according to a new study which says COVID-19 severity could be a deciding factor in having longer-lasting protection against reinfection.

headline: Video: Success In Giant Rocket Test For NASA Preparing Return To Moon
description: NASA successfully carried out a key static test of its troubled Space Launch System rocket on Thursday, a win for the agency as it prepares to return to the Moon.

headline: Mars May Be Hiding Most Of Its "Missing" Water Underground: NASA-Funded Study
description: Vast amounts of ancient water may have been trapped beneath the surface of Mars, according to a NASA-funded study which challenges the current theory that the Red Planet's water escaped into space.

headline: Water On Mars Buried Beneath Surface, Says Study
description: Billions of years ago, Mars was home to lakes and oceans -- but where all the water went to transform the planet into the desolate rock we know today has been something of a mystery.

headline: How Virtual Reality Helps US Space Force Stay In Shape To Tackle Crises
description: The U.S. Space Force is using virtual reality headsets to launch satellite mission operators into places they've never been before.

headline: China Eventually Wants Astronauts To Stay On Moon For Long
description: Once China establishes a lunar research station, its astronauts will stay on the moon for long periods of time as they conduct scientific studies, state media reported on Sunday, citing the architect of China's lunar programme.

headline: Researchers Shed Light On Factors That Help Avoid Covid Surge
description: A combination of robust vaccination programmes and strict physical distancing rules may be enough to prevent recurring peaks of COVID-19 without greatly restricting the mobility of people, according to a modelling study.

headline: "As They Roared Into Life....": Astrophysicist On Early Stars' Formation
description: For more than 100 million years after the big bang, the universe was dark.

headline: India's Next Mars Mission Likely To Be An Orbiter
description: As NASA's Perseverance rover landed on Mars in the early hours of Friday to look for signs of past life, ISRO's next mission to the Red Planet is likely to be an orbiter.

headline: NASA's Pursuit Of Flying A Helicopter On Mars For First Time
description: More than a century after the first powered flight on Earth, NASA intends to prove it's possible to replicate the feat on another world.

headline: India Is 3rd Globally In Scientific Publications After China, US: Centre
description: India has seen an exponential increase in the number of scientific publications over the last 10 years and is in the third position globally after China and the US, the Department of Science and Technology (DST) said.

headline: New Bat Discovered In Africa - And It's Orange, Black Like Halloween
description: Nancy Simmons was sitting in her office at the American Museum of Natural History two years ago when she got a startling text from a research expedition in Africa.

headline: New Population of Blue Whale Found In Western Indian Ocean, Say Experts
description: Scientists have found evidence of a previously undiscovered population of blue whales living in the western Indian ocean based on an analysis of sound recordings from the region, an advance which sheds light on the global distribution of the largest animals to have ever lived on the Earth.

headline: First Potential Radio Signal From Exoplanet Detected By Scientists
description: An international team of scientists has collected the first possible radio signal from a planet beyond our solar system, emanating from an exoplanet system about 51 light-years away.

headline: PSLV-C50 Mission: ISRO To Launch Communication Satellite CMS-01 Today
description: The Indian Space Research Organisation will today launch communication satellite CMS-01 on board the launch vehicle PSLV-C50. A 25-hour countdown for the launch began yesterday afternoon at 14:41 hours, ISRO said.

headline: Ultra Violet-Emitting LED Lights Can Kill Novel Coronavirus, Say Scientists
description: Ultraviolet (UV) light-emitting diodes (UV-LEDs) can kill the novel coronavirus efficiently, quickly, and cheaply, according to a study which says the new innovation could be installed in air conditioning and water systems.

headline: NASA Selects Indian-American Astronaut Raja Chari For Manned Mission To Moon
description: Raja Jon Vurputoor Chari, an Indian-American US Air Force colonel, is among 18 astronauts, half of them women, who have been selected by NASA for its ambitious manned mission to the Moon and beyond.

headline: IIT-Guwahati Researchers Develop Technology To Harvest Water From Air
description: Researchers at Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati claimed to have developed a new technology to harvest water from the air by using the concept of hydrophobicity.

headline: World's Smallest Atom-Memory Unit Is Faster And More Energy-Efficient
description: Researchers have created the smallest memory device yet, an advance that may lead to faster, smaller, and more energy-efficient electronic chips for consumer electronics and brain-inspired computing.

headline: China To Launch Mission, Seeking First Lunar Rock Retrieval Since 1970s
description: China plans to launch an unmanned spacecraft to the moon this week to bring back lunar rocks in the first attempt by any nation to retrieve samples from Earth's natural satellite since the 1970s.

headline: Scientists Discover Oldest Known Nano-Structures In Ancient Artifacts In Tamil Nadu
description: Scientists have discovered the oldest known human-made nanomaterials in the "unique black coatings" of ancient pottery shards - dated to 600 BC - unearthed from an archeological site in Keeladi, Tamil Nadu.

headline: Indian Tech Start-Up Bags UK-US Space Contract
description: An Indian tech start-up is among 10 winners to bag same-day contracts worth up to 53,000 pounds to fast-track the development of their innovations after directly pitching to the UK, US and NATO military leaders their solutions to key challenges within the aerospace and defence industry.

headline: SpaceX Crew Dragon Docks With International Space Station
description: A SpaceX Crew Dragon carrying four astronauts docked with the International Space Station on Monday, the first of what the US hopes will be many routine missions.

headline: Steroid Treatment Should Be Reserved For Sickest Covid Patients: Experts
description: Most adults with moderate-to-severe COVID-19 have a suppressed immune response against the novel coronavirus rather than life-threatening hyper-inflammation, according to a study which suggests steroids such as dexamethasone should be reserved for the sickest patients.

headline: Stanford University Names World's Top 2% Scientists, 36 Are From 2 IITs
description: At least 14 scientists from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) - Banaras Hindu University have figured among the top two per cent scientists in a global list compiled by the prestigious Standford University. The list also includes 22 faculty members or researchers from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Guwahati.

headline: Common Mutation May Make COVID-19 More Vulnerable To Vaccine, Says Study
description: A common mutation in the novel coronavirus that has enabled it to spread quickly around the world may also make it more susceptible to a vaccine, according to a study that proves some of the first concrete findings about how SARS-CoV-2, which causes COVID-19, is evolving.

headline: Scientists Discover "Hidden" Gene In COVID-19, May Add To Unique Biology: Report
description: Researchers have discovered a new "hidden" gene in the novel coronavirus which may contribute to its unique biology and pandemic potential, an advance that may lead to the development of new therapeutics against the deadly virus.

headline: Radio Burst From Within Milky Way May Help Solve Cosmic Mystery
description: Astrophysicists have detected a burst of cosmic radio waves within our solar system for the first time and identified its source, according to research published Wednesday that sheds new light on one of the mysteries of the Universe.

headline: Scientists Have Developed "Ultrapotent" COVID-19 Vaccine Candidate: Study
description: Scientists have developed a vaccine candidate for COVID-19 that produces "extremely high levels" of protective antibodies in animal models, an advance that may lead to a novel therapeutic to curb the pandemic.

headline: NASA Spacecraft Successfully Gets Sample From Asteroid Bennu
description: NASA said Thursday its robotic spacecraft Osiris-Rex was able to stow a rock and dust sample scooped up from the asteroid Bennu, after a flap that had wedged open put the mission at risk.

headline: NASA Spacecraft Touches Asteroid 200 Million Miles From Earth
description: NASA high-fived an asteroid for the first time Tuesday evening in a daring mission to better understand the origins of the universe.

headline: 3-Person Crew Blasts Off For International Space Station In Russian Capsule
description: Two cosmonauts and a NASA astronaut blasted off to the International Space Station Wednesday aboard a Russian capsule, in the first such launch since SpaceX's game-changing debut manned flight from US soil.

headline: Rahul Gandhi Taunts PM Over Wind Turbine Ideas, Ministers Hit Back
description: At least two union ministers today mocked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for his sarcastic tweet on Prime Minister's Narendra Modi's views expressed during an interaction with Henrik Andersen, head of Danish wind turbine-maker Vestas, a few days ago.

headline: Gene Mutation Behind Different COVID-19 Death Rates Among Indian States: Study
description: Variation in a genetic mutation among Indians may be the main reason behind the difference in the death rates due to COVID-19 across various states of the country, says a study that could inform new policies for controlling the novel coronavirus pandemic.

headline: Giant Black Hole Discovered At Centre Of Cosmic "Spider's Web"
description: Astronomers have discovered six galaxies ensnared in the cosmic "spider's web" of a supermassive black hole soon after the Big Bang, according to research published Thursday that could help explain the development of these enigmatic monsters.

headline: ISRO To Launch Its Venus Mission In 2025, France To Take Part: French Space Agency
description: ISRO is scheduled to launch its Venus mission in 2025 and France will participate in it, French space agency CNES said on Wednesday.

headline: Radiation On Moon 2.6 Times Greater Than International Space Station: Study
description: As the US prepares to return humans to the Moon this decade, one of the biggest dangers future astronauts will face is space radiation that can cause lasting health effects, from cataracts to cancer and neurodegenerative diseases.

headline: Team Led By Indians Finds X-Ray Signature Of Boundary Around Black Holes
description: A team of international scientists, led by those from India, has found a distinctive signature of cosmic X-rays to identify the boundary around black holes, which "unmistakably separate them" from other objects in the cosmos such as neutron stars that are comparable in mass and size.

headline: Indian-Origin Minister Unveils UK's Investment To Tackle Dangers By Space Debris
description: Alok Sharma, UK Secretary of State for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy, on Wednesday confirmed a GBP 1-million government investment to be divided between seven companies to tackle the dangers presented by space debris to satellites of everyday importance.

headline: "Exciting Signs Of Possible Presence Of Life": Scientist On Venus Find
description: The atmosphere of Venus contains traces of phosphine gas -- which on Earth is associated with living organisms -- scientists said on Monday, in fresh insight into conditions on our nearest planetary neighbour.

headline: Scientists Publish Images Of Coronavirus Infecting Respiratory Cells
description: Scientists have produced images of the novel coronavirus infecting lab-grown respiratory tract cells, findings that illustrate the number of virus particles that are produced and released per cell inside the lungs.

headline: US Spacecraft Named After Late Indian-American Astronaut Kalpana Chawla
description: An American commercial cargo spacecraft bound for the International Space Station has been named after fallen NASA astronaut Kalpana Chawla, the first India-born woman to enter space, for her key contributions to human spaceflight.

headline: PM Modi Pays Tribute To Renowned Radio Astronomer Govind Swarup, Grieves His Death
description: Paying rich tributes to renowned radio astronomer Govind Swarup, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday described him as an "exceptional scientist" while expressing grief at his death.

headline: Moon May Be Rusting Along Poles, Suggest Chandrayaan-1 Images
description: Images sent by Chandrayaan-1, India's first lunar mission, suggest that the Moon may be rusting along the poles, Union Minister Jitendra Singh said on Sunday.

headline: China Spacecraft Reuse Experiment Success Marks Breakthrough: Report
description: An experimental reusable spacecraft launched into orbit two days ago by China has successfully returned to a designated site on Sunday, the official Xinhua News Agency reported.

headline: Antibodies Against Coronavirus Stay In Body For At Least 60 Days: Study
description: A sero survey conducted at a leading hospital over five months has found that the prevalence of antibodies, in a person who has recovered from coronavirus infection, persists for 60-80 days.

headline: Cambridge University Kicks Off Vaccine Race To Fight All Coronaviruses
description: The University of Cambridge today confirmed plans to begin trials of a potential new vaccine not only against COVID-19 but all coronaviruses that may spill over from animals to humans in the future.

headline: Greenland Ice Sheet Sheds Half-A-Trillion Tonnes: Study
description: Greenland's massive ice sheet saw a record net loss of 532 billion tonnes last year, raising red flags about accelerating sea level rise, according to findings released Thursday.

headline: Top Researchers Identify 73 Variants Of COVID-19 Strain In Odisha
description: A team of genomic researchers from two institutes has identified 73 novel variants of the COVID-19 strain in Odisha, its head has said.

headline: ISRO Names Moon Crater Captured By Chandrayaan-2 After Vikram Sarabhai
description: Chandrayaan-2 has captured images of the Moon and one of the craters has been named after Vikram Sarabhai, the father of the Indian space programme, a statement said on Friday.

headline: Indian Scientists Make Space Bricks With Urea For Buildings On Moon
description: A team of researchers from the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) and the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has developed a sustainable process for making brick-like structures on the moon, according to IISc.

headline: "Baby" Milky Way Discovered 12 Billion Light Years Away
description: A golden halo glinting 12 billion light years away is the farthest galaxy resembling our Milky Way yet spotted, astronomers said Wednesday, adding the "surprisingly unchaotic" infant star system challenges our understanding of the early years of the Universe.

headline: Scientists Identify Immune System Variation Linked To Severe COVID-19 Cases
description: Scientists have found how misfiring of the immune system in some patients infected with the novel coronavirus can lead to severe consequences of COVID-19, an advance which may help identify those at high risk of dying from the disease, and suggest drugs to treat them.

headline: IISc Designs Eye Gaze-Controlled Robotic Arm For Speech, Motor Impaired
description: An Indian Institute of Science (IISc) research team has designed a robotic arm that can be manipulated by eye movement using a computer interface, to help people with Severe Speech and Motor Impairment (SSMI).

headline: Mysterious Pink Glacial Ice Seen In Italy, Scientists Start Investigation
description: Scientists in Italy are investigating the mysterious appearance of pink glacial ice in the Alps, caused by algae that accelerate the effects of climate change.

headline: ISRO's Mangalyaan Captures Image Of Phobos, Biggest Moon Of Mars
description: The Mars Colour Camera (MCC) onboard Indian Space Research Organisation's (ISRO) Mars Orbiter Mission has captured the image of Phobos, the closest and biggest moon of Mars.

headline: Why Canadian Sparrows Have Changed Their Tune
description: Members of a Canadian sparrow species famous for their jaunty signature song are changing their tune, a curious example of a "viral phenomenon" in the animal kingdom, a study showed Thursday.

headline: Ancient Australian Aboriginal Sites Discovered Underwater
description: Archaeologists have for the first time found Aboriginal artefacts on the seabed off Australia, opening a door to the discovery of ancient settlements flooded since the last ice age, they reported Thursday.

headline: Key Device Made In India For Global Project To Study Nuclear Fusion
description: Engineering and construction giant Larsen & Toubro said it has achieved a major milestone under 'Make in India' initiative by building a cryostat for the USD 20 billion global fusion project.

headline: Coronavirus Mutation Has Taken Over The World. Scientists Explore Why
description: When the first coronavirus cases in Chicago appeared in January, they bore the same genetic signatures as a germ that emerged in China weeks before.

headline: New Record Set For Earth's Longest Lightning, Both Distance And Duration
description: A single lightning flash stretched more than 700 kilometres across Brazil last year - equivalent to the distance between Boston and Washington DC - has created a new world record for the longest reported distance of lightning, the UN's weather agency has announced.

headline: Ocean On Jupiter's Moon Europa "Could Be Habitable": Study
description: Scientists have figured out how the subsurface ocean on Jupiter's moon Europa may have formed and determined that this vast expanse of water may have been able to support microbial life in the past.Europa, with an ocean hidden beneath a thick shell of ice, long has been viewed as a potential habitat for extraterrestrial life in our solar system, alongside other candidates such as Mars and Saturn's moon Enceladus.

headline: "Mystery Object" In Space May Be Smallest Black Hole, Say Scientists
description: A mysterious object roughly 800 light years from Earth detected using gravitational wave sensors is either one of the smallest black holes or one of the largest neutron stars so far discovered, scientists said on Wednesday.

headline: Plastic "Has Entered" Antarctic Terrestrial Food Chain
description: Scientists have found bits of polystyrene in the guts of tiny, soil-dwelling organisms in the Antarctic, raising concern that microplastics pollution has already "deeply" entered the world's most remote land-based food systems.

headline: New Lizard Species Discovered By Uddhav Thackeray's Son
description: Tejas Thackeray, younger son of Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray, and his team have discovered a new lizard species from Sakleshwar in central-western ghats of neighbouring Karnataka.

headline: IIT-Kharagpur Researchers Develop AI-Based System To Monitor Social Distancing
description: A group of researchers at IIT-Kharagpur has developed a cyber-physical system based on artificial intelligence for monitoring social distancing in public places, an official said on Saturday.

headline: Team Of Scientists To Examine Why Maharashtra's Lonar Lake Has Turned Pink
description: A team of scientists from the Nagpur-based National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (NEERI) will visit the Lonar lake in Maharashtra's Buldhana district next week and collect its water samples to analyse why it has turned pink, an official said.

headline: Bose-Einstein Quantum "Fifth State Of Matter" Seen For 1st Time In Space
description: Scientists have observed the fifth state of matter in space for the first time, offering unprecedented insight that could help solve some of the quantum universe's most intractable conundrums, research showed Thursday.

headline: Germany Aims To Become World's "Number One" In Green Hydrogen Technology
description: Germany aims to become the world's "number one" in green hydrogen technology, betting the fuel produced by renewable energy sources can both reduce carbon emissions globally and stimulate Europe's top economy.

headline: Earth Just Had Its Warmest May On Record Amid Siberian Heat Wave
description: Astonishing warmth in Siberia helped propel global average surface temperatures to a record high during May, according to the Copernicus Climate Change Service, a science division of the European Union.

headline: Closest Black Hole To Earth In Surprising Celestial Marriage With Two Stars
description: Astronomers have spotted the closest black hole to Earth ever discovered and are surprised about its living arrangements - residing harmoniously with two stars in a remarkable celestial marriage that may end in a nasty breakup.

headline: Indian-Origin Scientist On Team That Used AI To Crack COVID-19 Genome Signature
description: Scientists, including one of Indian origin, have used artificial intelligence (AI) to identify an underlying genomic signature for 29 different DNA sequences of the novel coronavirus that causes COVID-19, providing an important tool for vaccine and drug developers.

headline: IIT Bombay Researchers Get Patent For 'Smart Stethoscope'. How It's Different
description: A team at the Indian Institute of Technology of Bombay (IIT-B) has developed a "digital stethoscope" that can listen to heart beats from a distance and record them, minimising the risk of healthcare professionals contracting the novel coronavirus from patients.

headline: Indian Researchers Start Working On Novel Coronavirus Genome Sequencing
description: Whole-genome sequencing is the method used to determine the complete DNA sequence of a specific organism's genome.

headline: IISc Team Proposes Efficient Design For Quantum Circuits
description: The IISC team devised an algorithm to explicitly count the number of computing resources necessary, and optimized it to obtain maximum efficiency.

headline: Indian-origin Scientist Developing Robots With Human-like Ability In US
description: Humanoids or robots are in news for taking up certain chores like in restaurants or as cleaners but researchers led by an Indian-origin scientist at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) are now working on robots that can learn new tasks solely by observing humans.

headline: Whole Genome Sequencing Under GenomeIndia Project Started: Harsh Vardhan
description: Whole Genome Sequencing (WSG) under the 'GenomeIndia: Cataloguing the Genetic Variation in Indians' project has started. The proposed target of WSG is to do it for 10,000 individuals representing the country's diverse population.

headline: Coronavirus Lingers In Rooms And Toilets But Disinfectants Kill It
description: New research from Singapore published Wednesday showed that patients with the novel coronavirus extensively contaminate their bedrooms and bathrooms, underscoring the need to routinely clean high-touch surfaces, basins and toilet bowls.

headline: This Large Exoplanet Could Have Right Conditions For Life
description: Research led by an Indian-origin astronomer has found an exoplanet more than twice the size of Earth that could have the right conditions to sustain alien life.

headline: 79% Indian Birds On Decline, 101 Species Classified "High Concern": Report
description: There has been a decline in population of 79 per cent of Indian species of birds as per the assessment of current trends, but there is also some good news as the number of Indian peafowls (national bird peacock) has shown a dramatic rise, says a report.

headline: One-Third Of Plant, Animal Species Could Be Extinct By 2070: Study
description: Researchers have said that one in three plant and animal species could face extinction by 2070 because of climate change. The study, published in the journal Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, estimated broad-scale extinction patterns from climate change by incorporating data from recent climate-related extinctions and from rates of species movements.

headline: A Dying Star One Thousand Times Bigger Than The Sun Could Soon Explode
description: Betelgeuse, a reddish star that is part of the Orion constellation, may be entering a pre-supernova phase - where it gets fainter before collapsing in a fiery explosion.

headline: Car-Sized Prehistoric Turtle, Largest Ever, Was Built For Battle
description: One of the largest turtles that ever lived prowled the lakes and rivers of northern South America from about 13 million years ago to 7 million years ago - and this car-sized freshwater beast was built for battle.

headline: Half-A-Million Insect Species Face Extinction: Scientists
description: Half of the one million animal and plant species on Earth facing extinction are insects, and their disappearance could be catastrophic for humankind, scientists have said in a "warning to humanity".

headline: This Spacecraft Will Take First Images Of Sun's Unexplored Polar Regions
description: The US-European Solar Orbiter probe launches Sunday night from Florida on a voyage to deepen our understanding of the Sun and how it shapes the space weather that impacts technology back on Earth.

headline: Supermoon 2020: Difference Between A Regular Full Moon And Supermoon
description: The world is witnessing the first Full Moon of 2020 this weekend - with the best views expected on Sunday.

headline: Patients Infected 40 Employees At Hospital In Coronavirus-Hit Wuhan: Study
description: Forty health care workers were infected with the novel coronavirus by patients at a single Wuhan hospital in January, a new study has found, underscoring the risks to those at the frontlines of the growing epidemic.

headline: Watch The Sun's Remarkable Surface Up-Close In Never-Seen-Before Images
description: The never-before-seen images of the Sun's turbulent surface have been released by astronomers in the US.

headline: How Is China Coronavirus Different From 2003 SARS Outbreak? A Primer
description: The fast-spreading coronavirus that has now killed 81 people, infected 2,700 people across China and forced authorities to put several cities under lockdown, has brought back memories of the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) outbreak in 2003 that affected over 8,000 people and led to 650 deaths in China and 700 across the world.

headline: Meet 'Vyom Mitra', ISRO's Robot Which Will Travel To Space
description: Space agency ISRO has unveiled a robot which will travel to space as part of the agency's unmanned space mission to be launched this year as a prelude to the manned Gaganyaan mission.

headline: NASA To Build Homes Made Of Fungi On Moon, Mars
description: Instead of habitats made of metal and glass, NASA is exploring technologies that could grow structures out of fungi to become our future homes in the stars, and perhaps lead to more sustainable ways of living on Earth as well.

headline: Nearly Seven-Billion-Year-Old "Real Stardust" Found, Say Scientists
description: Researchers said Monday that new techniques have allowed them to identify the oldest solid material ever found on earth.

headline: This Planet Is Flinging Comets At Earth 'Like A Sniper'
description: New research suggests that Jupiter may be flinging dangerous objects into the inner solar system.

headline: And
description: A menu of about 30 dishes, including idli sambar, upma, vegetable pulav and egg rolls, has been prepared for astronauts of Mission Gaganyaan by Defence Food Research Laboratory.

headline: Earth-Sized World Found In "Habitable Zone" By NASA Planet Hunter
description: NASA said Monday that its planet hunter satellite TESS had discovered an Earth-sized world within the habitable range of its star, which could allow the presence of liquid water.

headline: How Experimental Supercells Cured An Infant's Deadly Genetic Illness
description: When a person's immune system is impaired by a genetic disease, a bone-marrow transplant can be a powerful therapeutic tool, but with a major downside: during the first few months the recipient's defenses against viruses are severely weakened. The slightest infection can lead to a hospital trip.

headline: Solar Eclipse 2019: Astronomer Suggests Safer Tools For Sky-Watchers
description: Partial Solar Eclipse December 2019: Sky-watchers should use safe viewing equipment and proper techniques to view the celestial event that will take place on December 26, a senior reasercher has said.

headline: MIT Scientists Develops 1st Laser Ultrasound, Not Requiring Body Contact
description: MIT scientists have developed a new ultrasound technique that does not require contact with the body to see inside a patient, an advance that may help remotely image and assess health of infants, burn victims, and accident survivors in hard-to-reach places.

headline: In A First, Spacecraft Circling The Sun Spots Huge Trail Of Asteroid Dust
description: Once there was an asteroid that flew too close to the sun. It was small and dark and rocky, too fragile to withstand such scorching conditions. The asteroid cracked, releasing a burst of dust and debris. Though it continued traveling along its orbit, it dropped millions of fragments in its wake.

headline: India Now World's 3rd Largest Producer Of Scientific Articles: US Report
description: India has emerged as the world's third largest publisher of science and engineering articles, according to a latest US report.

headline: Stone-Age "Chewing-Gum" Yields Human DNA; Did It Keep Its Flavour?
description: Danish scientists have managed to extract a complete human DNA sample from a piece of birch pitch more than 5,000 years old, used as a kind of chewing gum, a study revealed Tuesday.

headline: NASAs Time-Lapse Video Of Earths Glaciers Captures 50 Years Of Change
description: Decades of satellite images of the earth's glaciers and ice sheets have been compiled by NASA into a time-lapse video that shows how the planet's frozen regions are changing.

headline: Indian-Origin Scientist In US Finds Dead Probiotic That Can Fix Leaky Gut
description: A team led by an Indian-origin scientist has identified a dead probiotic that can reduce age-related leaky gut and control harmful, ageing-related inflammation.

headline: Core Stage Of Next Moon Rocket Now Ready Says NASA
description: NASA has completed the giant rocket that will take US astronauts back to the Moon, the space agency's head announced Monday, pledging the mission would take place in 2024 despite being beset by delays.

headline: How Mammals Became Good Listeners? New Fossils Reveal
description: Modern mammals, including humans, owe their keen sense of hearing to three tiny bones in the middle ear that were absent in their reptile ancestors, but the point at which this transformation occurred has remained unclear.

headline: NASA's Parker Solar Probe Reveals "New And Surprising" Solar Mystery
description: NASA's Parker Solar Probe, which has flown closer to the Sun than any spacecraft ever, has beamed back the first observations from its close encounters with the Sun, revealing a 'spectacular trove' of data about the solar wind and space weather, reported the US space agency.

headline: NASA To Launch A ''Robot Hotel'' Outside International Space Station
description: NASA is attaching a "robot hotel" to the outside of the International Space Station with the upcoming launch of the Robotic Tool Stowage (RiTS), a protective storage unit for critical robotic tools.

headline: How Scientists Use Loudspeakers To Make Dead Coral Reefs Sound Healthy
description: The desperate search for ways to help the world's coral reefs rebound from the devastating effects of climate change has given rise to some radical solutions.

headline: Ice Preserved Puppy For 18,000 Years. Scientists Are Fascinated
description: Researchers have big outstanding questions about the puppy they have named Dogor - "friend" in a language of the Siberian area where the creature spent 18,000 years in permafrost.

headline: Small And Fast, Strange Alien Comet From Another Star In Solar System
description: Something strange is sailing toward us. Something small and cold and extraordinarily fast. No one knows where it came from, or where it is going. But it's not from around here. This is an interstellar comet - an ancient ball of ice and gas and dust, formed on the frozen outskirts of a distant star, which some lucky quirk of gravity has tossed into our path.

headline: Scientists Spot Black Hole So Huge It "Shouldn't Even Exist In Our Galaxy"
description: Astronomers have discovered a black hole in the Milky Way so huge that it challenges existing models of how stars evolve, researchers said Thursday.

headline: Burial Site Of Babies Wearing Skulls Of Other Children Stun Archaeologists
description: They wielded obsidian knives to slice skulls off children's skeletons, scientists believe. Then they reassembled them atop the heads of dead infants, perhaps to protect them on a premature journey to the afterlife.

headline: Solar Eclipse 2019: What Is "Ring Of Fire" That Will Be Visible In India On December 26
description: Solar Eclipse in December 2019: The last solar eclipse of the year will fall on 26th December. The celestial event will be visible from India this time. Apart from India, it will also be visible from Saudi Arabia, Sumatra and Borneo, the space.com reports.

headline: Scientists Find Place In Ethiopia Where No Life Exists Despite Abundant Water
description: There is a place on Earth which does not harbour any form of life despite presence of water: hot, saline, hyperacid ponds in the Dallol geothermal field in Ethiopia.

headline: Gamma Ray Emission, Trillion Times More Energetic Than Light, Observed
description: In a cosmic first, researchers have observed the most powerful and luminous yet known energy release -- a trillion times more energetic than visible light -- in the brightest type of electromagnetic events known to occur in the universe called gamma-ray bursts (GRBs).

headline: India-UK Experts Begin Largest Study On Babies With Brain Injury In India
description: Leading experts from the UK and Indian universities have launched the world's largest study on babies with brain injuries in India this week to help prevent epilepsy.

headline: Chandrayaan 2's Vikram Hard-Landed Within 500 Meters Of Target: Centre
description: Chandrayaan-2's Vikram lander hard-landed as reduction in velocity during its descent was more than the designed parameters, the government said on Wednesday throwing more light on ISRO's dashed hopes of making a soft landing on the lunar surface in its maiden attempt.

headline: US Scientist Claims Photos Show Evidence Of Life On Mars
description: As scientists scramble to determine whether there is life on Mars, a researcher from Ohio University in US believes that there is evidence of insect-like creatures on the red planet.

headline: We're Living Through Earth's Second-Hottest Year, Says US Agency
description: This year is increasingly likely to be the planet's second- or third-warmest calendar year on record since modern temperature data collection began in 1880, according to data released this week by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.

headline: Mars 2020 Rover Will Visit The Perfect Spot To Find Signs Of Life
description: On some sunny day next summer, in front of a crowd at Kennedy Space Center, a rocket carrying NASA's next, best hope at finding life on Mars will launch into the sky.

headline: Meet Arrokoth, The Most Distant Space Object Ever Seen Up Close
description: The bundle of ice and rock was discovered using a telescope operated in Maryland. It was studied up close by a spacecraft built in the same state. So when NASA scientists had to choose an official name for the most distant object they had ever explored, they borrowed a word from the original inhabitants of this region: Arrokoth, the Powhatan/Algonquian term for "sky."

headline: "Ghost" Footprints Hiding Since End Of Ice Age Found Using Special Radar
description: Using a special type of radar, researchers have discovered the invisible footprints hiding since the end of the last ice age -- and what lies beneath them.

headline: Rare Deer-Like Animal Rediscovered In Vietnam After 30 Years
description: A very rare species of small, deer-like animal thought to be on the verge of extinction has been spotted in the northwestern jungle of Vietnam for the first time in nearly 30 years.

headline: NASA Captures Record-Breaking X-Ray Burst From Thermonuclear Blast
description: NASA has detected a massive thermonuclear explosion coming from outer space, caused by a massive thermonuclear flash on the surface of a pulsar -- the crushed remains of a star that long ago exploded as a supernova.

headline: Mercury To Make A Rare Pass Across Sun Today For Last Time In 13 Years
description: Mercury is set to make a transit across the sun on Monday morning for the last time until 2032. A pinprick of darkness will puncture a small hole in the sunlight as the planet traverses the solar disk during a 5.5-hour stretch, starting at 7:35 a.m. Eastern time.

headline: This Flying Robot Can Clean Glass Curtain Walls In High-Rises
description: Chinese researchers have designed a novel flying robot that not only climbs walls as seen in science fiction movies but is also capable of avoiding obstacles and even jumping over grooves on wall surfaces.

headline: Latent View Analytics IPO Subscribed 6.39 Times On First Day
description: The company plans to use the proceeds from the IPO for funding inorganic growth worth Rs 147.90 crore

headline: Sapphire Foods IPO Fully Subscribed On Second Day Of Issue
description: Sapphire Foods on November 8 had raised Rs 933 crore from anchor investors

headline: Zomato's Net Loss Stands At 435 Crore in September Quarter
description: Food delivery giant Zomato's consolidated net loss widened to Rs 435 crore in the second quarter of 2021-22

headline: Cabinet Okays Norms For Mandatory Jute Usage In Packaging
description: Government has okayed reservation norms for jute packaging materials where 100 per cent food grains will be packed in jute bags

headline: Cabinet Okays Ethanol Price Hike, To Benefit Sugarcane Farmers
description: With Uttar Pradesh assembly elections just months away, the central government on Wednesday cleared a hike in ethanol price by 80 paise a litre

headline: Bank Of Baroda's September Quarter Profit Up 24% On Year-On-Year Basis
description: The bank's net interest income rose by 2 per cent to Rs 7,566 crore in September quarter of 2021-22

headline: Paytm's IPO Subscribed 1.89 Times On Final Day
description: Paytm's initial public offer got subscribed 1.89 times on Wednesday, the final day of its subscription

headline: Excise Duty Cuts On Fuels To Positively Impact Inflation: RBI Governor
description: "Core inflation has remained elevated... and we are keeping a very close watch onthe evolution of core inflation," RBI Governor said

headline: Sensex, Nifty Decline For Second Straight Session Dragged By Banking Shares
description: HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, Tata Steel, Hindustan Unilever and Kotak Mahindra Bank were among the top drags on the Sensex.

headline: What Are Fan Tokens? Find Out How They Work And Their Difference From NFTs
description: Fan tokens give holders access to a variety of fan-related membership perks

headline: Nykaa CEO: "Learning About India Beyond Delhi, Mumbai Most Fascinating"
description: "For us, to be able to grow the business, we needed to educate the customer, that too digitally. That's why Nykaa, in many ways, has created the beauty business in India," Ms Nayar said.

description: A cryptocurrency exchange acts like an intermediary  a brokerage firm  between a buyer and a seller of cryptocurrency. headline: Has Any Country Other Than El Salvador Classified Bitcoin As Legal Tender? Find Out
description: Legalising Bitcoin as legal tender means governments will have to give sovereign backing to the cryptocurrency. One of the major reasons for yet not legalising cryptocurrency as legal tender could be their highly volatile nature and the unpredictability of the disruption that they may cause. It could also be possible that governments around the world may be waiting for the underlying blockchain technology to mature before giving a sovereign backing to this form of currency.
